longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content:
An Ordinance
to establish an independent body to regulate accounting professionals through registration, issuing practising certificates, inspection, investigation and disciplinary sanction, and to oversee the performance by the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants of its functions in relation to certified public accountants; to provide for a review and appeal mechanism regarding decisions made against those regulated by the Council; to provide for enquiries into non-compliances with regulatory requirements for financial reports of listed entities; to provide for the levies payable to the Council; and to provide for related matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: 2019 Amending Ordinance (《2019年修訂條例》) means the Financial Reporting Council (Amendment) Ordinance 2019 (3 of 2019); (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
#2019 Ordinance commencement date (《2019年條例》生效日期) means the day on which section 23 of the 2019 Amending Ordinance comes into operation; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
2021 Amending Ordinance (《2021年修訂條例》) means the Financial Reporting Council (Amendment) Ordinance 2021 (41 of 2021); (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
+2021 Ordinance commencement date (《2021年條例》生效日期) means the day on which section 3 of the 2021 Amending Ordinance comes into operation; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
Advisory Committee (諮詢委員會) means the Advisory Committee referred to in section 10B; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
AFRC (會財局) means the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
AFRC register (會財局註冊紀錄冊) means the register of certified public accountants (practising), CPA firms and corporate practices established and maintained under section 20AAZZI; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the accounts of a listed corporation, means an audit of those accounts required for the purposes of the relevant Ordinance or the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), as in force at the material time, or the Listing Rules;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the accounts of a relevant undertaking of a listed entity, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case where an audit of those accounts is required for the purposes of the relevant Ordinance or the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), or the corporate law of a place outside Hong Kong, as in force at the material time, such an audit so required;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the audit of those accounts, regardless of whether or not required for the purposes of any constitutional instrument of the undertaking; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.def: authorized institution (認可機構) means an authorized institution within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

books (簿冊) includes accounts and accounting information, however compiled or stored, and whether recorded in a legible form or recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form;
certified public accountant (會計師) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the PA Ordinance; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)
Commissioner of Inland Revenue (稅務局局長) means the Commissioner of Inland Revenue appointed under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112);
company (公司) means a company within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
complete (完成)—see section 3A(3); (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
corporate practice (執業法團) means a company registered as a corporate practice under Division 3 of Part 2A; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 5)

CPA firm (會計師事務所) means—(a)a certified public accountant (practising) who practises accountancy on the accountant’s own account under a firm name registered under Division 2 of Part 2A; or(b)a firm of certified public accountants (practising) that—(i)practises accountancy in partnership; and(ii)is registered under Division 2 of Part 2A; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
CPA inspector (會計師查察員) means a person appointed as a CPA inspector under section 20ZZA; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
CPA investigator (會計師調查員) means a person appointed as a CPA investigator under section 20ZZG; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
CPA misconduct (會計師失當行為)—see section 37AA; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
CPA register (會計師註冊紀錄冊) means the register of certified public accountants kept under section 22 of the PA Ordinance; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
debenture (債權證) means a debenture within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a decision referred to in paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of specified decision—means the HKICPA Council; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a decision referred to in paragraph (aa), (a)(ii) or (b) of the definition of specified decision—means the AFRC; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)

subsection.def: Director of Audit (審計署署長) means the Director of Audit appointed in accordance with the Basic Law; (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 62)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any register, books and tape recording;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any input or output, in whatever form, into or from an information system; and

paragraph.name: c

subsection.def: engagement partner (項目合夥人), in relation to a practice unit or registered PIE auditor, means a partner or other person authorized by the unit or auditor to be responsible for the PIE engagements carried out by the unit or auditor; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

engagement quality control review (項目質素監控審視), in relation to a practice unit or registered PIE auditor, means a process designed by the unit or auditor to provide an objective evaluation of any significant judgement made and conclusion reached in formulating the reports of the PIE engagements carried out by the unit or auditor; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

engagement quality control reviewer (項目質素監控審視員), in relation to a practice unit or registered PIE auditor, means a person authorized by the unit or auditor to oversee the engagement quality control reviews carried out in relation to the PIE engagements carried out by the unit or auditor; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

firm name (事務所名稱)—(a)in relation to a certified public accountant (practising) who practises accountancy on the accountant’s own account—means the name or style under which the accountant practises if the name or style is otherwise than the accountant’s own name as registered under section 22(2) of the PA Ordinance; or(b)in relation to a firm of certified public accountants (practising) that practises accountancy in partnership—means the name or style under which the firm practises; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
FR inspector (財匯查察員) means a person appointed as an FR inspector under section 21A; (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b
a
paragraph.content: for a PIE auditor—see section 37A; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor—see section 37B; (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.def: function (職能) includes a power and a duty;
HKEC (交易結算公司) means the company incorporated, and registered by the name “Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited”, under the relevant Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; E.R. 2 of 2020)
HKICPA (香港會計師公會) means the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants incorporated by section 3 of the PA Ordinance; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)
HKICPA Council (公會理事會) means the Council of the HKICPA established by section 10(1) of the PA Ordinance; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)
HKICPA Registrar (公會註冊主任) means the Registrar appointed under section 21 of the PA Ordinance; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)
Independent Commission Against Corruption (廉政公署) means the Independent Commission Against Corruption established by section 3 of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204);
information system (資訊系統) means an information system within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);
Insurance Authority (保監局) means the Insurance Authority established under section 4AAA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 148)
Investigation Board (調查委員會) means the Audit Investigation Board established by section 22(1);

list of registered responsible persons (註冊負責人名單), in relation to a registered PIE auditor, means the list of registered responsible persons of the auditor, as recorded in the PIE auditors register; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
listed collective investment scheme (上市集體投資計劃)—see section 3; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
listed corporation (上市法團)—see section 3; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
listed entity (上市實體)—see section 3; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a prospectus; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a document issued for the purposes of the Listing Rules that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: offers any securities issued by the corporation to the public for subscription, or purchase, for a consideration; or

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a listed collective investment scheme or a collective investment scheme seeking to be listed, means a document issued for the purposes of the relevant code or the Listing Rules that— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: offers any interests in the scheme to the public for acquisition for a consideration;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: offers the scheme to the public for participation for a consideration; or

def.continued: approved by the Securities and Futures Commission under section 24 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), and as in force at the material time;

subsection.def: manager (管理人), in relation to a collective investment scheme or listed collective investment scheme, means the person who is responsible, for the purposes of the relevant code or the Listing Rules, for the operation, and the management of the property, of the scheme for the benefit of those who hold interests in the scheme; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4)
Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority (強積金管理局) means the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority established by section 6(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485);
Monetary Authority (金融管理專員) means the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A(1) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);
non-PIE (非公眾利益實體)—see section 3; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
non-PIE auditor (非公眾利益實體核數師)—see section 3A; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

def.name: Nonpractitioner
def.leadIn: non-practitioner (非執業人士) means an individual who is not, and has not at any time within the previous 3 years been—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant (practising); or

paragraph.name: b
a
b

def.leadIn: non-Hong Kong entity (非香港實體)— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 267; 31 of 2025 s. 183)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means—

subparagraph.content: a collective investment scheme constituted under the laws of any place outside Hong Kong; or
a body corporate incorporated outside Hong Kong,

paragraph.content: does not include a re-domiciled company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 14 of 2025 s. 267)

def.name: Party
def.leadIn: party (一方), in relation to a review of a specified decision, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who applies for the review; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: PA Ordinance (《專業會計師條例》) means the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50); (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)

PAO professional standard (《專業會計師條例》專業標準) means any statement of professional ethics, or standard of accounting, auditing or assurance practices, issued or specified, or deemed to have been issued or specified, under section 18A of the PA Ordinance; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
PIE—see section 3; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
PIE auditor (公眾利益實體核數師)—see section 3A; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
PIE auditors register (公眾利益實體核數師註冊紀錄冊) means the register of PIE auditors established under section 20ZX; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
PIE engagement (公眾利益實體項目)—see section 3A; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

practice unit (執業單位) means—(a)a certified public accountant (practising) who practises accountancy on the accountant’s own account under the accountant’s own name as registered under section 22(2) of the PA Ordinance;(b)a CPA firm; or(c)a corporate practice; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 5)
practising certificate (執業證書) means a practising certificate issued under section 20AAD or 20AAI; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
practising certificate application (發證申請) means an application made under section 20AA; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
professional indemnity insurance (專業彌償保險) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the PA Ordinance; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
professional person (專業人士) means—(a)a certified public accountant; or(b)a practice unit; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any statement of professional ethics, or standard of accounting, auditing or assurance practices, issued or specified, or deemed to have been issued or specified, under section 18A of the PA Ordinance; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any standard on professional ethics, or accounting, auditing or assurance practices, issued or specified by—

subparagraph.content: the International Accounting Standards Board;
the International Auditing and Assurance Standards Board; or
the International Ethics Standards Board for Accountants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any standard on professional ethics, or accounting, auditing or assurance practices, specified in the Listing Rules; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: any standard on professional ethics, or accounting, auditing or assurance practices, comparable to that referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) which is allowed—

subparagraph.content: by the Securities and Futures Commission pursuant to the relevant code; or
by the HKEC pursuant to the Listing Rules; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

subsection.def: prospectus (招股章程) means a prospectus within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a person holding an office of emolument under the Government, whether such office be permanent or temporary; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person holding such an office by virtue only of being the chairperson of a board or tribunal established under an Ordinance; or (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is a judicial officer for the purpose of section 2 of the Judicial Officers Recommendation Commission Ordinance (Cap. 92) or a judicial officer appointed by the Chief Justice;

subsection.def: quality control system (質素監控制度), in relation to a practice unit or registered PIE auditor, means the policies and procedures established and maintained by the unit or auditor to ensure that a PIE engagement carried out by the unit or auditor complies with the applicable professional standards and legal and regulatory requirements; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

quality control system responsible person (質素監控制度負責人), in relation to a practice unit or registered PIE auditor, means a person authorized by the unit or auditor to be responsible for the quality control system of the unit or auditor; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
recognition application (PIE auditor) (公眾利益實體核數師認可申請) means an application made under section 20ZE; (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)
recognized exchange company (認可交易所) means a company recognized as an exchange company under section 19(2) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
recognized stock market (認可證券市場) means a stock market operated by a recognized exchange company; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

def.name: Record
def.leadIn: record (紀錄) means any record of information (however compiled or stored) and includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any books, deed, contract, agreement, voucher and receipt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document or other material used with or produced by an information system;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any information that is recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any document, disc, tape, sound track or other device in which sounds or other data (not being visual images) are embodied so as to be capable (with or without the aid of other equipment) of being reproduced; and

paragraph.name: e

subsection.def: registered office (註冊辦事處)—(a)in relation to a certified public accountant (practising)—means the registered office of the accountant referred to in section 20AAQ;(b)in relation to a CPA firm—means the registered office of the firm referred to in section 20AAZK; or(c)in relation to a corporate practice—means the registered office of the practice referred to in section 20AAZZE; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)

registered responsible person (註冊負責人), in relation to a registered PIE auditor, means an individual whose name is recorded in the PIE auditors register as a responsible person of the auditor; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
Registrar of Companies (公司註冊處處長) means the Registrar of Companies appointed under section 21(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
registration application (corporate practice) (法團註冊申請) means an application made under section 20AAZM; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
registration application (CPA firm) (事務所註冊申請) means an application made under section 20AAS; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
registration application (PIE auditor) (公眾利益實體核數師註冊申請) means an application made under section 20G; (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士), in relation to the AFRC, means— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4; 41 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed by the AFRC under section 10; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed as a consultant, agent or adviser of the AFRC under section 10; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4; 41 of 2021 s. 5)

subsection.def: relevant code (有關守則) means—(a)a code or guideline published under section 112ZR of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), as in force at the material time; or(b)a code or guideline published under section 399 of that Ordinance for providing guidance in relation to the operation of section 104 of that Ordinance, as in force at the material time; (Replaced 16 of 2016 s. 46)

subsection.def: relevant Ordinance (《有關條例》) means the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force from time to time before the commencement date* of section 2 of Schedule 9 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: ii

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the standards of accounting practices issued or specified, or deemed to have been issued or specified, under section 18A of the PA Ordinance, as in force at the material time; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: B
C
subparagraph.content: the Listing Rules; or

subparagraph.name: D

subparagraph.name: i

subparagraph.name: ii
iii

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any generally acceptable accounting principles allowed for usage under the Listing Rules; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4)

subsection.def: renewal application (corporate practice registration) (法團註冊續期申請) means an application made under section 20AAZR; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)
renewal application (CPA firm registration) (事務所註冊續期申請) means an application made under section 20AAX; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a collective investment scheme or listed collective investment scheme, means—

subparagraph.content: the manager of the scheme; or
the person appointed as the trustee, or custodian, of the property of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b

an engagement quality control reviewer of the unit or auditor; or

subparagraph.content: to refuse to add the name of a person to the list of registered responsible persons of a registered PIE auditor under section 20Y; or (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a decision by the AFRC— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)

subparagraph.content: to refuse a renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) under section 20ZL;
to impose or amend a condition in relation to the recognition of a PIE auditor under section 20ZR;
to revoke or suspend the recognition of a PIE auditor under section 20ZS or 20ZV;
to revoke the recognition of a Mainland auditor under section 20ZT(5); or
to impose a sanction under section 37CA, 37D, 37E or 37F; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5; L.N. 66 of 2022)

def.name: SpecifiedEnforcementAgency
def.leadIn: specified enforcement agency (指明執行機構) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Police of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the HKICPA;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the HKEC;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Registrar of Companies;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Inland Revenue;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the Official Receiver;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority; or

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: the Market Misconduct Tribunal;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a prospectus issued by or on behalf of a listed corporation or a corporation seeking to be listed, means any report, specified in Part II of the Third Schedule to the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), that is required under section 38 or 342 of that Ordinance to be set out in the prospectus; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 3 of 2019 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a listing document (other than a prospectus) issued by or on behalf of a listed corporation or listed collective investment scheme, or a corporation or collective investment scheme seeking to be listed, means any report on the profits and losses of, the assets and liabilities of, and other financial information on— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the corporation or scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a business or undertaking to be acquired, or disposed of, by the corporation or scheme,

paragraph.continued: that is required for inclusion in the listing document issued for the purposes of the relevant code or the Listing Rules; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 4)

subsection.def: Tribunal (審裁處) means the Accounting and Financial Reporting Review Tribunal continued under section 37N; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 5)
undertake (承擔)—see section 3A(2); (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)
undertaking (企業) includes an unincorporated association carrying on a trade or business (whether or not for profit), a corporation and a partnership.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the performance of a function includes the exercise of a power and the discharge of a duty.
In this Ordinance, a reference to the interest of the investing public does not include any interest the taking into consideration of which is or is likely to be contrary to the public interest.
For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person is given a reasonable opportunity of being heard if the person is given an opportunity to make written or oral representations. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 4)

editorialNote.content:
# 2019 Ordinance commencement date: 1 October 2019.
* Commencement date: 3 March 2014.
+ Commencement date: 1 October 2022.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of listed entity, PIE, etc.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
subsection.def: listed collective investment scheme (上市集體投資計劃) means a collective investment scheme that is or was listed; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 5)
listed corporation (上市法團) means a corporation that is or was listed; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 5)
listed corporation (equity) (上市股權法團) means a listed corporation the listed securities of which comprise at least shares or stocks; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a listed corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a listed collective investment scheme; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 5)

subsection.def: non-PIE (非公眾利益實體) means a listed corporation that is not a listed corporation (equity); (Added 3 of 2019 s. 5)
PIE means a public interest entity; (Added 3 of 2019 s. 5)

def.name: PublicInterestEntity
def.leadIn: public interest entity (公眾利益實體) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a listed corporation (equity); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a listed collective investment scheme. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation is listed if any securities issued by the corporation are listed on a recognized stock market; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a collective investment scheme is listed if any interests in the scheme are listed on a recognized stock market.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the securities issued by a corporation are taken to be listed on a recognized stock market if, on the application of the corporation or of a holder of the securities, the company operating the market has agreed to allow, subject to the requirements of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), dealings in those securities to take place on the market; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, after the securities are taken to be listed on a recognized stock market by virtue of paragraph (a), dealings in those securities on the market are suspended, the suspension does not affect the operation of that paragraph in relation to those securities.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the interests in a collective investment scheme are taken to be listed on a recognized stock market if, on the application of a responsible person of the scheme, the company operating the market has agreed to allow, subject to the requirements of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), dealings in those interests to take place on the market; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, after the interests are taken to be listed on a recognized stock market by virtue of paragraph (a), dealings in those interests on the market are suspended, the suspension does not affect the operation of that paragraph in relation to those interests.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Dealing
def.leadIn: dealing (交易), in relation to securities issued by a corporation or interests in a collective investment scheme, means, whether as principal or agent, making or offering to make an agreement with another person, or inducing or attempting to induce another person, to enter into or to offer to enter into an agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for or with a view to acquiring, disposing of, subscribing for or underwriting such securities or interests; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the purpose or pretended purpose of which is to secure a profit to any of the parties—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: from the yield of such securities or interests; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by reference to fluctuations in the value of such securities or interests. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 5)

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Meaning of various types of auditors and engagements

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
subsection.def: non-PIE auditor (非公眾利益實體核數師) means a practice unit that undertakes or carries out a non-PIE engagement;
non-PIE engagement (非公眾利益實體項目) means an engagement specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1A;

def.name: PIEAuditor
def.leadIn: PIE auditor (公眾利益實體核數師) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered PIE auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a recognized PIE auditor;

subsection.def: PIE engagement (公眾利益實體項目) means an engagement specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1A;

recognized PIE auditor (認可公眾利益實體核數師) means a non-Hong Kong auditor recognized under Division 3 of Part 3, including a Mainland auditor recognized under section 20ZT; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 6; 31 of 2025 s. 184)
registered PIE auditor (註冊公眾利益實體核數師) means a practice unit registered under Division 2 of Part 3. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 6)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person undertakes a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement when the person accepts the appointment for carrying out the engagement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement is completed when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the engagement is for the preparation of an auditor’s report referred to in item 1(a)(i) of Part 1, or item 1(a) of Part 2, of Schedule 1A, the report is sent under section 430 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the engagement is for the preparation of an auditor’s report referred to in item 1(a)(ii) or (b) of Part 1, or item 1(b) of Part 2, of Schedule 1A, the report is issued for the purposes of the relevant code or the Listing Rules, as the case requires;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the engagement is for the preparation of a specified report referred to in item 2 of Part 1, or item 2 of Part 2, of Schedule 1A, the listing document in which the report is included is issued for the purposes of the Listing Rules; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the engagement is for the preparation of an accountant’s report referred to in item 3 of Part 1 of Schedule 1A, the circular in which the report is included is issued for the purposes of the Listing Rules.

subsection.content: Nothing in this Ordinance prevents a registered PIE auditor from undertaking or carrying out a non-PIE engagement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a professional person commits a professional irregularity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falsifies or causes to be falsified a document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes a statement, in respect of a document, that is material and that the person knows to be false or does not believe to be true;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to observe, maintain or otherwise apply a PAO professional standard;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an AML/CTF requirement;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with a requirement imposed under section 20ZZC(1) or 20ZZJ(1);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: fails to comply with—

subparagraph.content: the provisions of any bylaw or rule made or any direction lawfully given by the HKICPA Council; or
any regulation made or any direction lawfully given by the AFRC;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: is negligent in the conduct of the person’s profession;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: is guilty of professional misconduct; or

paragraph.leadIn: while being a responsible person of a limited partnership fund—

subparagraph.content: causes or allows a breach of an AML/CTF requirement by the fund; or
fails to take reasonable steps to prevent such a breach.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), where the professional person is a certified public accountant, the person also commits a professional irregularity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: while being a certified public accountant (practising), practises accountancy on the person’s own account under a name other than—

subparagraph.content: the person’s own name as registered under section 22(2) of the PA Ordinance at the time the person so practises; or
the person’s firm name as registered in the AFRC register at the time the person so practises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: renders any service as, or purporting to be—

subparagraph.content: a partner of a firm of certified public accountants (practising) the name of which does not, at the time of rendering the service, appear in the AFRC register; or
a director of a corporate practice the name of which does not, at the time of rendering the service, appear in the AFRC register;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is guilty of dishonourable conduct;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: while being a director of a corporate practice—

subparagraph.content: causes or allows a breach of an AML/CTF requirement by the corporate practice; or
fails to take reasonable steps to prevent a breach of an AML/CTF requirement by the corporate practice; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: while being a director of a corporation that is a TCSP licensee—

subparagraph.content: causes or allows a breach of an AML/CTF requirement by the corporation; or
fails to take reasonable steps to prevent such a breach.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), where the professional person is a firm of certified public accountants (practising), the person also commits a professional irregularity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: renders any service under a firm name other than the name in which the person is, at the time of rendering the service, registered in the AFRC register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is guilty of dishonourable conduct.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), where the professional person is a corporate practice, the person also commits a professional irregularity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to comply with a requirement specified in section 20AAZX(3), (4), (5) or (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement specified in section 20AAZZG(2) or (4);

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: practises accountancy as such a practice without being covered by professional indemnity insurance as required by this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: does or omits to do something that, if the person were an individual certified public accountant, would reasonably be regarded by an individual as being dishonourable conduct; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: while being a director of a corporation that is a TCSP licensee—

subparagraph.content: causes or allows a breach of an AML/CTF requirement by the corporation; or
fails to take reasonable steps to prevent such a breach.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: accounting professional (會計專業人士) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to the AMLO;

AML/CTF requirement (反洗錢／恐怖分子資金籌集規定) means a requirement that—(a)is set out in Part 2, 3 or 4 of Schedule 2 to the AMLO; and(b)applies—(i)for subsections (1)(d) and (2)(d)(ii) and (iii)—under section 5A(3) of the AMLO to an accounting professional;(ii)for subsections (2)(e) and (4)(f)—under section 5A(5) of the AMLO to a TCSP licensee; and(iii)for subsection (1)(i)—under section 34(1) of the Limited Partnership Fund Ordinance (Cap. 637) to an accounting professional appointed as a responsible person of a limited partnership fund;
AMLO (《反洗錢條例》) means the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615);
director (董事) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to the AMLO;

dishonourable conduct (不名譽行為)—(a)in relation to a certified public accountant—means an act or omission of the accountant, whether or not done or made in the course of carrying out professional work or as a certified public accountant, that would reasonably be regarded as bringing or likely to bring discredit on the accountant, the HKICPA or the accountancy profession; or(b)in relation to a firm of certified public accountants (practising)—means an act or omission of the firm, whether or not done or made in the course of carrying out professional work or as a firm of certified public accountants, that would reasonably be regarded as bringing or likely to bring discredit on the firm, the HKICPA or the accountancy profession;
TCSP licensee (信託或公司服務持牌人) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to the AMLO.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Practice irregularity by PIE auditors, non-PIE auditors, etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a PIE auditor or non-PIE auditor has committed a practice irregularity if, in relation to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement completed on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date, the auditor— (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falsified or caused to be falsified a document;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: has been guilty of professional misconduct; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: did or omitted to do something that would reasonably be regarded as bringing or likely to bring discredit on the auditor, the HKICPA or the accountancy profession. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), where the PIE auditor or non-PIE auditor is a corporate practice, the auditor has also committed a practice irregularity if, in relation to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement completed on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date— (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the auditor— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 7)

subparagraph.content: ceased to comply with a requirement specified in section 20AAZX(3), (4), (5) or (6); (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 8)
failed to comply with a requirement specified in section 20AAZZG(2) or (4); (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 8)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: rendered any service under a company name other than the name in which the auditor was, at the time of rendering the service, registered in— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 8)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for a PIE auditor—the PIE auditors register; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for a non-PIE auditor—the AFRC register;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: practised accountancy as such a practice without being covered by professional indemnity insurance as required by this Ordinance.

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: failed or neglected to observe, maintain or otherwise apply a professional standard; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: refused or neglected to comply with the provisions of any bylaw or rule made or any direction lawfully given by the HKICPA Council, or any direction lawfully given by the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a director (who is a certified public accountant) of the auditor— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: rendered any service as, or purporting to be, a director of a company whose name did not, at the time of rendering the service, appear in— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 7; 41 of 2021 s. 8)

subparagraph.name: A
B
ii
subparagraph.content: practised accountancy as such a director at a time when the auditor was not covered by professional indemnity insurance as required by this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), where the PIE auditor or non-PIE auditor is a certified public accountant (practising), the auditor has also committed a practice irregularity if, in relation to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement completed on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date, the auditor— (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: failed or neglected to observe, maintain or otherwise apply a professional standard; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refused or neglected to comply with the provisions of any bylaw or rule made or any direction lawfully given by the HKICPA Council, or any direction lawfully given by the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), where the PIE auditor or non-PIE auditor is a firm of certified public accountants (practising), the auditor has also committed a practice irregularity if, in relation to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement completed on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date, the auditor— (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: failed or neglected to observe, maintain or otherwise apply a professional standard;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refused or neglected to comply with the provisions of any bylaw or rule made or any direction lawfully given by the HKICPA Council, or any direction lawfully given by the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: rendered any service under a firm name other than the name in which the auditor was, at the time of rendering the service, registered in— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 8)

subparagraph.content: for a PIE auditor—the PIE auditors register; or
for a non-PIE auditor—the AFRC register.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor has committed a practice irregularity if, in relation to a PIE engagement completed by the auditor on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falsified or caused to be falsified a document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made a statement, in relation to a document, that was material and that the person knew to be false or did not believe to be true;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been negligent in the conduct of the person’s profession;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has been guilty of professional misconduct;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: failed or neglected to observe, maintain or otherwise apply a professional standard; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: refused or neglected to comply with the provisions of any bylaw or rule made, or any direction lawfully given, by the HKICPA Council, or any direction lawfully given by the AFRC. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 7)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance (except section 50), there is a relevant non-compliance in relation to a listed entity if a relevant financial report, within the meaning of Part 1 of Schedule 1, of the entity has not complied with a relevant requirement, within the meaning of Part 1 of that Schedule, that applies to the report.

For the purposes of section 50, there is a relevant non-compliance in relation to a listed corporation if a relevant financial report, within the meaning of Part 2 of Schedule 1, of the corporation has not complied with a relevant requirement, within the meaning of Part 2 of that Schedule, that applies to the report.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the 2021 Ordinance commencement date, the body corporate established under the former section 6(1) and known as “Financial Reporting Council” in English and “財務匯報局” in Chinese immediately before that date is known as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “Accounting and Financial Reporting Council” in English; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “會計及財務匯報局” in Chinese. (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 10)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Despite the repeal of the former section 6(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body corporate established under that section continues in existence as the AFRC on and after the 2021 Ordinance commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accordingly, the jurisdiction, powers, functions and duties of that body corporate are not affected in any way by the change of name effected by subsection (1). (Added 41 of 2021 s. 10)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: To avoid doubt, the repeal of the former section 6(1) or the change of name effected by subsection (1) does not affect any power exercised or function or duty performed by that body corporate before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date. (Added 41 of 2021 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 8; 41 of 2021 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has perpetual succession under its corporate name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must provide itself with a common seal; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is capable of suing and being sued in its corporate name.

subsection.content: The AFRC is not a servant or agent of the Government and does not enjoy any status, immunity or privilege of the Government. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former section 6(1) (原有第6(1)條) means section 6(1) as in force immediately before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date. (Added 41 of 2021 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC is to consist of the following members— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a chairperson, who is a non-executive director of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: at least 7 other members, who are either executive or non-executive directors of the AFRC.

subsection.content: All members of the AFRC must be non-practitioners appointed by the Chief Executive.
Among the members of the AFRC, the number of non-executive directors must exceed the number of executive directors.

subsection.leadIn: Among the members of the AFRC— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least one-third must be appointed from among persons who appear to the Chief Executive to be suitable for appointment, because of their knowledge and experience in PIE engagements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the others must be appointed from among persons who appear to the Chief Executive to be suitable for appointment, because of—

subparagraph.content: their knowledge in accounting, auditing, finance, banking, law, administration or management; or
their professional or occupational experience.

subsection.content: A public officer is not eligible for appointment as a member of the AFRC.
The Chief Executive must publish in the Gazette a notice of each appointment under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may perform any of its functions, and its proceedings are valid, despite— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vacancy in its membership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a defect in the appointment or qualification of a person purporting to be its member;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a defect in its composition under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a minor irregularity in the convening of any of its meetings.

subsection.content: If any requirement under this section is not complied with, the Chief Executive must as soon as practicable take the necessary action to ensure that the requirement is complied with.
Schedule 2 has effect with respect to the AFRC and its members.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Functions of AFRC
section.leadIn: The functions of the AFRC are— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 11; 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to regulate—

subparagraph.content: certified public accountants through issuing practising certificates, and through investigation and disciplinary sanction;
CPA firms and corporate practices through registration, and practice units through inspection, investigation and disciplinary sanction; and
auditors of listed entities through a registration and recognition mechanism, and through inspection, investigation and disciplinary sanction; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to oversee the HKICPA’s performance of the following functions—

subparagraph.content: ascertaining whether persons are qualified for registration as certified public accountants by conducting examinations and acting in such other manner as may be necessary, and dealing with applications and other matters relating to the registration of certified public accountants; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 12)
arranging with accountancy bodies in places outside Hong Kong for the mutual or reciprocal recognition of accountants; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 12)
setting continuing professional development requirements for certified public accountants; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 12)
issuing or specifying standards on professional ethics, and accounting, auditing and assurance practices, for certified public accountants; and (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 12)
providing training for qualifying for registration as, and the continuing professional development of, certified public accountants; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to monitor, through enquiries, the compliance by listed entities of regulatory requirements for financial reports; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: with respect to each of the inspections, investigations or enquiries, to decide on, and carry out, the appropriate action in accordance with this Ordinance; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 11)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to approve and oversee the policies and activities of the Investigation Board, a Review Committee, and a committee established by the AFRC; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 11; 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: to refer to a specified body any case or complaint concerning—

subparagraph.content: any FR misconduct by a PIE auditor or registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 11. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
the undertaking or carrying out of any PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 11. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 12)
any relevant non-compliance in relation to a listed entity; or (Added 3 of 2019 s. 11. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 12)
any CPA misconduct by a professional person; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: to provide assistance to a specified body on the body’s request for assistance in dealing with any case or complaint concerning— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 11)

subparagraph.content: any FR misconduct by a PIE auditor or registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 11. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
the undertaking or carrying out of any PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 11. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 12)
any relevant non-compliance in relation to a listed entity; or (Added 3 of 2019 s. 11. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 12)
any CPA misconduct by a professional person; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: to take any steps that the AFRC considers appropriate to promote and support the development of the accountancy profession; and (Added 41 of 2021 s. 12)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to perform such other functions as are imposed on the AFRC under this or any other Ordinance. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 11; 41 of 2021 s. 12)

subsection.content: The AFRC may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of its functions. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 12; 41 of 2021 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), the AFRC may, for performing its functions under section 9(a), request the HKICPA to provide information that the AFRC reasonably requires. (Added 41 of 2021 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1AAB
subsection.content: The HKICPA must comply with any request made under subsection (1AA). (Added 41 of 2021 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsections (1) and (1AA), the AFRC may, for performing its function under section 9(b)— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: request the HKICPA to provide information and periodic reports on the HKICPA’s performance of a specified function;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conduct assessment on the HKICPA’s performance of a specified function; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if satisfied that it is in the public interest to do so, give written directions to the HKICPA on the performance of a specified function. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The HKICPA must comply with any direction given under subsection (1A)(c). (Added 3 of 2019 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsections (1), (1AA) and (1A), the AFRC may— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 12; 41 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employ persons to assist the AFRC, the Investigation Board, a Review Committee, a committee established by the AFRC, or any or all of them, in the performance of its or their functions; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint persons as consultants, agents or advisers to assist the AFRC, the Investigation Board, a Review Committee, a committee established by the AFRC, or any or all of them, in the performance of its or their functions; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hold, acquire, lease, sell, charge, dispose of or otherwise deal with all kinds of property, whether movable or immovable;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: with the approval of the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, borrow money on security or other conditions;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: accept gifts;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: receive and expend moneys;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: publish or otherwise make available materials indicating to the public any matter relating or incidental to the performance by the AFRC of any of its functions; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: do all such things as the AFRC thinks fit in respect of its administration and management; and (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers as are conferred on the AFRC under this or any other Ordinance. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 12; 41 of 2021 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified function (指明職能) means a function of the HKICPA mentioned in section 9(b). (Added 3 of 2019 s. 12)

subsection.content: The AFRC may, in connection with the performance of a function under this Ordinance, give directions to professional persons.

subsection.leadIn: A direction under subsection (1) may require a professional person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is or was a certified public accountant—

subparagraph.content: to produce or provide to the AFRC a document or information in connection with the registration of the person under the PA Ordinance as a certified public accountant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is or was a certified public accountant (practising)—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is or was a CPA firm—

subparagraph.content: to deliver to the AFRC a certificate of registration in the possession, custody or control of the person if the registration to which the certificate relates has ceased to be valid; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is or was a corporate practice—

subparagraph.content: to produce or provide to the AFRC a document or information in connection with the registration of the corporate practice; or
to deliver to the AFRC a certificate of registration in the possession, custody or control of the person if the registration to which the certificate relates has ceased to be valid.

subsection.leadIn: Also, a direction under subsection (1) may require a professional person to give to the AFRC an explanation for an act or omission of the person that appears to the AFRC to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: conduct unbecoming of a professional person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: conduct that may affect the reputation, integrity and status of the AFRC or of the accountancy profession; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: conduct that may fall within section 3B.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section is to be taken to compel the production or provision by a person of any document or information containing privileged communication by or to a legal practitioner in that capacity.
For the purposes of sections 3B(1)(f)(ii) and 4(2)(a)(vi), (3)(b), (4)(b) and (5)(g), a direction given under subsection (1) is a direction lawfully given by the AFRC.
This section does not limit section 10.
There is to be an Advisory Committee to advise the AFRC on matters of policy regarding any of its regulatory objectives and functions.
The Advisory Committee is to be constituted in accordance with Part 4A of Schedule 2 and must conduct its business in accordance with that Part.
The Advisory Committee must meet at least once every 3 months to advise the AFRC.
The AFRC may request the Advisory Committee to advise it on matters of policy regarding any of its regulatory objectives and functions.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the AFRC may delegate, in writing, any of its functions to— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 13; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an employee of the AFRC, whether by reference to the employee’s name or to the office held by the employee.

subsection.content: The AFRC must not delegate any of its functions specified in Schedule 3A. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 13)
If the AFRC delegates a function under this section, it may at the same time authorize the delegate to sub-delegate the function.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 13; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke a delegation, or an authorization in respect of a sub-delegation, under this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach restrictions or conditions to a delegation under this section; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: attach restrictions or conditions to an authorization in respect of a sub-delegation under this section, including those on the exercise of power to sub-delegate.

subsection.content: A delegation or sub-delegation under this section does not prevent the AFRC or its delegate from concurrently performing the function delegated or sub-delegated.

If a person purports to act pursuant to a delegation or sub-delegation under this section, the person is presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to be acting in accordance with the terms of the delegation or sub-delegation.

Without prejudice to subsection (5), if there is a delegation or sub-delegation under this section in respect of a function of the AFRC, any reference in this or any other Ordinance to the AFRC in connection with the performance of the function is, unless the context otherwise requires, to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Assistance, etc. to specified authorities under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC is of the opinion that the conditions in subsection (2) are satisfied, it may, subject to subsections (4) and (5)— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 14; 41 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: refer to a specified authority any case or complaint concerning—

subparagraph.content: any FR misconduct by a PIE auditor or registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 14)
any relevant non-compliance in relation to a listed entity; or (Added 3 of 2019 s. 14)
any CPA misconduct by a professional person; and (Added 41 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: provide assistance to a specified authority on the authority’s request for assistance in dealing with any case or complaint concerning— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 14)

subparagraph.content: any FR misconduct by a PIE auditor or registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 14)
any relevant non-compliance in relation to a listed entity; or (Added 3 of 2019 s. 14)
any CPA misconduct by a professional person. (Added 41 of 2021 s. 15. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the referral, or the provision of assistance, will enable or assist the specified authority to perform its functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not contrary to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest that the case or complaint should be referred or the assistance should be provided.

subsection.leadIn: In forming an opinion on the conditions set out in subsection (2) for the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the AFRC must take into account— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 14; 41 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the specified authority will pay to the AFRC any of the costs and expenses incurred in providing the assistance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the specified authority will be able and willing to provide reciprocal assistance.

subsection.leadIn: If the specified authority falls within paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of specified authority in section 2(1), the AFRC must satisfy itself that— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 14; 41 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: performs any function similar to a function of the AFRC under section 9(a), (b), (c) or (d); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: regulates, supervises or investigates—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: accountants;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: banking, insurance or other financial services; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the affairs of corporations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the case or complaint is referred, or the assistance is provided—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with a view to the authority’s performance of any of its regulatory, supervisory or investigatory function; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: otherwise for the purpose of such function.

subsection.leadIn: If the specified authority falls within paragraph (a)(ii) of the definition of specified authority in section 2(1), the AFRC must satisfy itself that— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 14; 41 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the case or complaint is referred, or the assistance is provided—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with a view to the authority’s taking of any disciplinary action, or conducting of any investigation, against any of the members or regulatees of the authority; or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: otherwise for the purpose of such action or investigation.

subsection.content: If the AFRC has, for the purposes of subsection (4) or (5), satisfied itself that a specified authority falls within subsection (4)(a) and (b) or (5)(a), the AFRC must as soon as practicable thereafter cause the name of the authority to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person is required—

subparagraph.content: to give any explanation or further particulars, or to answer a question, under section 20ZZJ or 25; or (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 14)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the explanation, particulars, information or answer might tend to incriminate the person, and the person so claims before giving the explanation, particulars, information or answer,

subsection.continued: the AFRC must not provide evidence of the requirement, as well as the explanation, particulars or information, or the question and answer, to a specified authority in a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong for use in criminal proceedings against the person in that jurisdiction.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may issue guidelines not inconsistent with this Ordinance— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 15; 41 of 2021 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating the manner in which it proposes to perform its functions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidance on the operation of any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The AFRC must publish the guidelines in the Gazette. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 15; 41 of 2021 s. 16)

The AFRC may amend or revoke any of the guidelines. Subsection (2) applies to such an amendment or revocation in the same way as it applies to the issue of a guideline. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 15; 41 of 2021 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: A person does not incur any civil or criminal liability only because the person has contravened any of the guidelines. If, in any legal proceedings, the court or magistrate is satisfied that such a guideline is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guideline is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene the guideline may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate the matter.

subsection.content: A guideline issued under this section is not subsidiary legislation.

After consultation with the chairperson of the AFRC, the Chief Executive may, if satisfied that it is in the public interest to do so, give the AFRC written directions the Chief Executive considers appropriate on the performance of any of the AFRC’s functions. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 16)
The AFRC must comply with any direction given under subsection (1). (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: If a direction is given under subsection (1), a requirement under an Ordinance that the AFRC must, for the purpose of performing any of the functions to which the direction relates— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 16; 41 of 2021 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: form any opinion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be satisfied as to any matter (including the existence of particular circumstances); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consult any person,

subsection.continued: does not apply for any purpose connected with the performance of functions pursuant to, or consequent upon, the direction.

section.name: s15
section.heading: AFRC to furnish information
section.leadIn: When required by the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, the AFRC must furnish to the Secretary— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 17; 41 of 2021 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such information as the Secretary specifies on the principles, practices and policy the AFRC is pursuing or adopting, or proposes to pursue or adopt, in performing any of the AFRC’s functions; and (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 17; 41 of 2021 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for pursuing or adopting, or proposing to pursue or adopt, those principles, practices and policy.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Exemption from taxation
section.content: The AFRC is exempt from taxation under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the financial year of the AFRC begins on 1 April of each calendar year. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

subsection.leadIn: The first financial year of the AFRC after the commencement# of section 23 of the 2019 Amending Ordinance (first financial year)— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins on the 2019 Ordinance commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ends on the 31 March immediately after the first anniversary of that commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must submit, for approval by the Financial Secretary, the estimates of its income and expenditure— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first financial year—as soon as practicable after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the second financial year—before the 31 December immediately before the end of the first financial year; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for any other financial year—before 31 December of the preceding financial year.

subsection.content: The AFRC must keep proper accounts and records of its transactions.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the end of each financial year of the AFRC, the AFRC must cause to be prepared for the financial year a statement of accounts of the AFRC that— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 20; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: gives a true and fair view of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the state of affairs of the AFRC as at the end of that financial year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the results of the operations and cash flows of the AFRC in that financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is signed by the chairperson, and the chief executive officer, of the AFRC.

subsection.content: The statement of accounts prepared under section 18(2) is to be audited by the Director of Audit who must make a report to the AFRC on the audit of that statement.

A report made under subsection (1) is to contain a statement by the Director of Audit as to whether in the Director’s opinion the statement of accounts gives a true and fair view of the matters set out in section 18(2)(a)(i) and (ii).

The Director of Audit is entitled to have access to such books of account and other records of the AFRC as the Director considers necessary to perform the Director’s functions as the auditor of the AFRC.

The Director of Audit is entitled to require from any person holding, or accountable for, those books of account and records such information and explanation as the Director considers necessary to perform the Director’s functions as the auditor of the AFRC.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Reports and statement to be laid before Legislative Council

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the end of each financial year of the AFRC, the AFRC must submit to the Financial Secretary— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 22; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a report on the activities of the AFRC for that financial year; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the statement of accounts prepared under section 18(2) for that financial year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the report made under section 19(1) on the audit of that statement.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary must cause the documents received under subsection (1) to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Issue of Practising Certificate and Registration of Firm Name, Firm and Corporate Practice etc.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Issue of Practising Certificate to Certified Public Accountant

subsection.content: A certified public accountant may apply to the AFRC for a practising certificate.
The application must be made in the form and way specified by the AFRC.
The AFRC may grant or refuse a practising certificate application.
The AFRC must not grant a practising certificate application unless it is satisfied that the applicant meets the requirements specified in section 20AAL.

The AFRC may grant a practising certificate application subject to the condition that the applicant must comply with the additional continuing professional development requirements set by the AFRC within a period specified by the AFRC.
The AFRC must inform the applicant for a practising certificate application of its decision on the application by written notice.
If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAD
section.heading: Issue of practising certificate
section.content: If the AFRC grants a practising certificate application, the AFRC must, on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3B (if any), issue a practising certificate to the applicant in the form specified by the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: A practising certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the practising certificate takes effect.

subsection.content: A practising certificate is renewable annually.
A certified public accountant (practising) may apply to the AFRC for renewal of the accountant’s practising certificate.
The application must be made no later than 15 December of the year in which the current practising certificate expires.
The application must be made in the form and way specified by the AFRC.
The AFRC may grant or refuse a renewal application (practising certificate).
The AFRC must not grant a renewal application (practising certificate) unless it is satisfied that the applicant continues to meet the requirements specified in section 20AAL.

The AFRC may grant a renewal application (practising certificate) subject to the condition that the applicant must comply with the additional continuing professional development requirements set by the AFRC within a period specified by the AFRC.
The AFRC must inform the applicant for a renewal application (practising certificate) of its decision on the application by written notice.
If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAI
section.heading: Issue of practising certificate on renewal
section.content: If the AFRC grants a renewal application (practising certificate), the AFRC must, on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3B (if any), issue a renewed practising certificate to the applicant in the form specified by the AFRC.

section.name: s20AAJ
section.heading: Current practising certificate remains in force until decision on renewal takes effect

subsection.content: This section applies if a renewal application (practising certificate) has been made but the application is not finally determined before the expiry of the current practising certificate.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 20AAE(1), the current practising certificate remains in force until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the practising certificate is renewed—the day on which the renewal takes effect under section 20AAK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the day on which the refusal takes effect under Part 3C.

section.name: s20AAK
section.heading: Validity period of renewed practising certificate
section.leadIn: The renewal of a practising certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the renewal takes effect.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Requirements for Issue or Renewal of Practising Certificate and Supplementary Provisions

section.name: s20AAL
section.heading: Requirements for issue or renewal of practising certificate

subsection.leadIn: The requirements specified for the purposes of sections 20AAB(2) and 20AAG(2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.leadIn: has had not less than 30 months of full time approved accounting experience in one or more specified offices after—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: becoming a member of a specified accountancy body; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: being registered as a certified public accountant; or

subparagraph.leadIn: has had not less than 4 years of full time approved accounting experience in one or more specified offices and at least 1 year of that experience has been acquired after the applicant—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: has become a member of a specified accountancy body; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has been registered as a certified public accountant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant possesses the local experience and knowledge of local law and practice that the HKICPA Council considers necessary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant has complied with the continuing professional development requirements set by the HKICPA;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the applicant is not bankrupt or has not entered into a voluntary arrangement (as defined by section 2 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6)) with the applicant’s creditors;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant is not subject to—

subparagraph.content: an order made by a Disciplinary Committee under the former section 35(1)(db) of the PA Ordinance; or
a sanction imposed by the AFRC under section 37CA(2)(f);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the applicant intends to practise as a certified public accountant (practising); and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the applicant satisfies the fit and proper requirement to be a certified public accountant under the PA Ordinance.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), the HKICPA Council may require the whole or any part of the full time approved accounting experience mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii) to have been acquired within the period preceding the practising certificate application or renewal application (practising certificate) (as may be applicable) specified by the HKICPA Council.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the HKICPA Council may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the applicant to sit the examinations set by the HKICPA Council, which must include an examination in local law and taxation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the applicant to have had not less than 1 year of full time approved accounting experience in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The AFRC may dispense with the requirements under subsection (1)(b) or (d) if the AFRC considers that the applicant has acquired substantial experience in accountancy, either in Hong Kong or elsewhere, over a period of time considered sufficient by the AFRC.

A person registered as a public accountant (as defined by section 2(1) of the PA Ordinance) immediately before the relevant day (as defined by section 2(1) of that Ordinance) is exempted from meeting the requirements under subsection (1)(a), (b) and (d).

For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), a person is regarded as ordinarily resident in Hong Kong if the person has been present in Hong Kong for not less than 180 days during the period of 12 months preceding the practising certificate application or renewal application (practising certificate) (as may be applicable).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former section 35(1)(db) of the PA Ordinance (《專業會計師條例》原有第35(1)(db)條) means section 35(1)(db) of the PA Ordinance as in force immediately before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date;
specified office (指明辦事處) means the office of—(a)a certified public accountant (practising); or(b)a person practising public accountancy in the jurisdiction of a specified accountancy body.
