subsection.content: An applicant for a practising certificate application or renewal application (practising certificate) must provide the AFRC with the information that the AFRC reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.
In considering the application, the AFRC may have regard to any information in its possession (whether or not provided by the applicant).

section.name: s20AAN
section.heading: Offence of fraudulent procurement of issue of practising certificate

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person fraudulently procures the issue of a practising certificate under this Division to the person or any other person by means of any misleading, false or fraudulent representation or statement, whether made orally or in writing.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Cancellation or Suspension of Practising Certificate

section.name: s20AAO
section.heading: Cancellation or suspension of practising certificate on non-disciplinary grounds

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may cancel the practising certificate held by a certified public accountant (practising) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the accountant fails to commence practice within 6 months after the date of issue of the practising certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the accountant has become bankrupt or has entered into a voluntary arrangement (as defined by section 2 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6)) with the accountant’s creditors.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may cancel or suspend the practising certificate held by a certified public accountant (practising) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the accountant requests the AFRC to do so;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the AFRC is satisfied that the practising certificate has been issued—

subparagraph.content: by mistake; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the AFRC is of the opinion that the accountant has failed to comply with any condition imposed under section 20AAB(3) or 20AAG(3) regarding the additional continuing professional development requirements.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), the AFRC may suspend the practising certificate held by a certified public accountant (practising) for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate.

section.name: s20AAP
section.heading: Notification of cancellation or suspension of practising certificate

subsection.content: If the AFRC decides to cancel or suspend the practising certificate held by a certified public accountant (practising) under section 20AAO(1) or (2), the AFRC must inform the accountant of its decision by written notice.
The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.
A certified public accountant (practising) must have a registered office in Hong Kong to which all communications and notices may be addressed.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s20AAR
section.heading: Obligation to inform AFRC of changes in particulars

subsection.content: If there is a change in any of the specified particulars of a certified public accountant (practising), the certified public accountant (practising) must, within 14 days after the day on which the change takes place, inform the AFRC of the change by written notice.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified particulars (指明詳情) means—(a)full name;(b)address of registered office;(c)telephone number; and(d)electronic mail address.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Registration of Firm Name or Firm

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Application for Registration of Firm Name or Firm

subsection.content: A certified public accountant (practising) who intends to practise accountancy on the accountant’s own account under a firm name may apply to the AFRC for registration of the firm name.
A firm of certified public accountants (practising) that intends to practise accountancy in partnership may apply to the AFRC for registration of the firm (including the firm name).

subsection.leadIn: The application under subsection (1) or (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the form and way specified by the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B (if any).

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a registration application (CPA firm).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must not grant a registration application (CPA firm) unless it is satisfied that the applicant meets the requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a firm name—specified in section 20AAZD; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the composition of a firm (if applicable)—specified in section 20AAZE.

subsection.content: The AFRC must inform the applicant for a registration application (CPA firm) of its decision on the application by written notice.
If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAV
section.heading: Issue of certificate of registration
section.content: If the AFRC grants a registration application (CPA firm), the AFRC must issue a certificate of registration to the applicant in the form specified by the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a firm name or firm—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the registration takes effect.

subsection.content: The registration of a firm name or firm is renewable annually.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Renewal of Registration of Firm Name or Firm

subsection.content: A certified public accountant (practising) who practises accountancy on the accountant’s own account under a firm name registered under this Division may apply to the AFRC for renewal of the registration of the firm name.

subsection.leadIn: A firm of certified public accountants (practising) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: practises accountancy in partnership; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is registered under this Division,

subsection.continued: may apply to the AFRC for renewal of the registration of the firm (including the firm name).

subsection.leadIn: The application under subsection (1) or (2) must be made no later than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 15 December of the year in which the current registration expires; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a later day approved by the AFRC either generally or in respect of a particular application.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the form and way specified by the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B (if any).

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a renewal application (CPA firm registration).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must not grant a renewal application (CPA firm registration) unless it is satisfied that the applicant continues to meet the requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a firm name—specified in section 20AAZD; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the composition of a firm (if applicable)—specified in section 20AAZE.

subsection.content: The AFRC must inform the applicant for a renewal application (CPA firm registration) of its decision on the application by written notice.
If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAZA
section.heading: Issue of certificate of registration on renewal
section.content: If the AFRC grants a renewal application (CPA firm registration), the AFRC must issue a renewed certificate of registration to the applicant in the form specified by the AFRC.

section.name: s20AAZB
section.heading: Current registration remains in force until decision on renewal takes effect

subsection.content: This section applies if a renewal application (CPA firm registration) has been made but the application is not finally determined before the expiry of the current registration.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 20AAW(1), the current registration remains in force until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registration is renewed—the day on which the renewal takes effect under section 20AAZC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the day on which the refusal takes effect under Part 3C.

section.name: s20AAZC
section.heading: Validity period of renewed registration
section.leadIn: The renewal of registration of a firm name or firm—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the renewal takes effect.

section.name: s20AAZD
section.heading: Registration requirements—firm name
section.leadIn: The requirements specified for the purposes of sections 20AAT(2)(a) and 20AAY(2)(a) are that the firm name under which the applicant intends to practise or practises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not the same as a firm name already registered under this Division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not, in the opinion of the AFRC, so nearly resemble a firm name already registered under this Division as to be likely to cause confusion; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not, in the opinion of the AFRC, misleading, offensive or otherwise contrary to the public interest.

section.name: s20AAZE
section.heading: Registration requirements—firm composition
section.leadIn: The requirements specified for the purposes of sections 20AAT(2)(b) and 20AAY(2)(b) are that, in relation to a firm of certified public accountants (practising) that intends to practise or practises accountancy in partnership—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the partners are certified public accountants; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least a proportion of the partners, as specified by the AFRC, is a certified public accountant (practising) or are certified public accountants (practising).

subsection.content: An applicant for a registration application (CPA firm) or renewal application (CPA firm registration) must provide the AFRC with the information that the AFRC reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.
In considering the application, the AFRC may have regard to any information in its possession (whether or not provided by the applicant).

section.name: s20AAZG
section.heading: Offence of fraudulent procurement of registration of firm name or firm

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person fraudulently procures the registration of a firm name or firm under this Division by means of any misleading, false or fraudulent representation or statement, whether made orally or in writing.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Revocation or Suspension of Registration of Firm Name or Firm

section.name: s20AAZH
section.heading: Revocation or suspension of registration on non-disciplinary grounds

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must revoke the registration of the firm name under which a certified public accountant (practising) practises accountancy on the accountant’s own account if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the accountant dies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the accountant ceases to be a certified public accountant (practising).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must revoke the registration of a firm of certified public accountants (practising) that practises accountancy in partnership, and of the firm name under which the firm practises, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the firm ceases to operate and the partnership is dissolved; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the firm ceases to be a firm of certified public accountants (practising).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may revoke or suspend the registration of a firm name or firm if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the CPA firm requests the AFRC to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the AFRC is satisfied that the CPA firm has been registered—

subparagraph.content: by mistake; or
in consequence of any misleading, false or fraudulent statement, declaration or representation, whether made orally or in writing.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3), the AFRC may suspend the registration of a firm name or firm for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate.

section.name: s20AAZI
section.heading: Notification of revocation or suspension of registration

subsection.content: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the registration of a firm name or firm under section 20AAZH(1), (2) or (3), the AFRC must inform the CPA firm of its decision by written notice.
The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAZJ
section.heading: Effect of revocation or suspension of registration

subsection.content: If the registration of a firm name or firm is revoked under section 20AAZH(1), (2) or (3) or 37CA(2)(d)(i), the certificate of registration issued to the CPA firm under section 20AAV or 20AAZA is cancelled with effect from the date on which the revocation takes effect.

If the registration of a firm name or firm is suspended under section 20AAZH(3) or 37CA(2)(d)(ii), the certificate of registration issued to the CPA firm under section 20AAV or 20AAZA is suspended during the period in which the suspension of registration is in effect.
A CPA firm must have a registered office in Hong Kong to which all communications and notices may be addressed.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s20AAZL
section.heading: Obligation to inform AFRC of changes in particulars

subsection.content: If there is a change in any of the specified particulars of a CPA firm, the CPA firm must, within 14 days after the day on which the change takes place, inform the AFRC of the change by written notice.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified particulars (指明詳情) means—(a)full name;(b)address of registered office;(c)telephone number; and(d)electronic mail address.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Application for Registration of Corporate Practice

subsection.content: A company may apply to the AFRC to be registered as a corporate practice.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the form and way specified by the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B (if any).

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a registration application (corporate practice).
The AFRC must not grant a registration application (corporate practice) unless it is satisfied that the applicant meets the requirements specified in section 20AAZX.
The AFRC must inform the applicant for a registration application (corporate practice) of its decision on the application by written notice.
If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAZP
section.heading: Issue of certificate of registration
section.content: If the AFRC grants a registration application (corporate practice), the AFRC must issue a certificate of registration to the applicant in the form specified by the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a company as a corporate practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC grants the company’s registration application (corporate practice)—on the day specified in the notice from the AFRC under section 20AAZO(1); or
if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the registration takes effect.

subsection.content: The registration of a company as a corporate practice is renewable annually.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Renewal of Registration of Corporate Practice

subsection.content: A corporate practice may apply to the AFRC for renewal of its registration.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be made no later than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 15 December of the year in which the current registration expires; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a later day approved by the AFRC either generally or in respect of a particular application.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the form and way specified by the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B (if any).

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a renewal application (corporate practice registration).
The AFRC must not grant a renewal application (corporate practice registration) unless it is satisfied that the applicant continues to meet the requirements specified in section 20AAZX.
The AFRC must inform the applicant for a renewal application (corporate practice registration) of its decision on the application by written notice.
If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAZU
section.heading: Issue of certificate of registration on renewal
section.content: If the AFRC grants a renewal application (corporate practice registration), the AFRC must issue a renewed certificate of registration to the applicant in the form specified by the AFRC.

section.name: s20AAZV
section.heading: Current registration remains in force until decision on renewal takes effect

subsection.content: This section applies if a renewal application (corporate practice registration) has been made but the application is not finally determined before the expiry of the current registration.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 20AAZQ(1), the current registration remains in force until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registration is renewed—the day on which the renewal takes effect under section 20AAZW; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the day on which the refusal takes effect under Part 3C.

section.name: s20AAZW
section.heading: Validity period of renewed registration
section.leadIn: The renewal of registration of a corporate practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC grants the practice’s renewal application (corporate practice registration)—on the day specified in the notice from the AFRC under section 20AAZT(1); or
if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the renewal takes effect.

subsection.content: This section sets out the requirements specified for the purposes of sections 20AAZN(2) and 20AAZS(2).

subsection.leadIn: The applicant is a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: limited by shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of which every member and every director is a natural person.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is a company that has only 1 member, both of the following conditions are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member is a certified public accountant (practising);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is the only director of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is a company that has 2 or more members, all of the following conditions are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each member is a certified public accountant;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: each member is a director of the company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no person other than a member of the company is a director of the company.

subsection.content: The applicant meets the professional indemnity requirements set out in section 20AAZY.

subsection.leadIn: The articles of association of the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements of the rules made under section 51 of the PA Ordinance (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include articles that are appropriate to the applicant having regard to the requirements specified in subsections (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The company name under which the applicant intends to practise or practises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not the same as a company name of a corporate practice already registered under this Division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not, in the opinion of the AFRC, so nearly resemble a company name of a corporate practice already registered under this Division as to be likely to cause confusion; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not, in the opinion of the AFRC, misleading, offensive or otherwise contrary to the public interest.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, nothing in subsections (3) and (4) is to be construed as repealing by implication, or otherwise affecting, any provision of Part IVA of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) in its application to a director of a company.

subsection.leadIn: The professional indemnity requirements for the purposes of section 20AAZX(5) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant under section 20AAZX is to be or is covered by professional indemnity insurance provided by an approved insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the insurance is provided—

subparagraph.content: on terms specified in the PAO rules; or
if the terms are not so specified—on terms that have been approved by the HKICPA Council; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is covered by the insurance at least to the extent required by the PAO rules.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approved insurer (認可保險人) means an insurer who is approved by the HKICPA Council to provide professional indemnity insurance to a corporate practice;
PAO rules (《規則》) means the rules made under section 51 of the PA Ordinance.

subsection.content: An applicant for a registration application (corporate practice) or renewal application (corporate practice registration) must provide the AFRC with the information that the AFRC reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.
In considering the application, the AFRC may have regard to any information in its possession (whether or not provided by the applicant).

section.name: s20AAZZA
section.heading: Offence of fraudulent procurement of registration of corporate practice

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person fraudulently procures the registration of the person or any other person as a corporate practice under this Division by means of any misleading, false or fraudulent representation or statement, whether made orally or in writing.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Revocation or Suspension of Registration of Corporate Practice

section.name: s20AAZZB
section.heading: Revocation or suspension of registration on non-disciplinary grounds

subsection.content: The AFRC must revoke the registration of a corporate practice if the practice has commenced to be wound up.
The AFRC may revoke the registration of a corporate practice if the practice ceases to be a company described in section 20AAZX(2).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may revoke or suspend the registration of a corporate practice if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the practice requests the AFRC to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the AFRC is satisfied that the practice has been registered—

subparagraph.content: by mistake; or
in consequence of any misleading, false or fraudulent statement, declaration or representation, whether made orally or in writing.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3), the AFRC may suspend the registration of a corporate practice for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate.

section.name: s20AAZZC
section.heading: Notification of revocation or suspension of registration

subsection.content: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the registration of a corporate practice under section 20AAZZB(1), (2) or (3), the AFRC must inform the practice of its decision by written notice.
The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20AAZZD
section.heading: Effect of revocation or suspension of registration

subsection.content: If the registration of a corporate practice is revoked under section 20AAZZB(1), (2) or (3) or 37CA(2)(d)(i), the certificate of registration issued to the practice under section 20AAZP or 20AAZU is cancelled with effect from the date on which the revocation takes effect.

If the registration of a corporate practice is suspended under section 20AAZZB(3) or 37CA(2)(d)(ii), the certificate of registration issued to the practice under section 20AAZP or 20AAZU is suspended during the period in which the suspension of registration is in effect.
A corporate practice must have a registered office (within the meaning of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)) in Hong Kong to which all communications and notices may be addressed.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s20AAZZF
section.heading: Obligation to inform AFRC of changes in particulars

subsection.content: If there is a change in any of the specified particulars of a corporate practice, the practice must, within 14 days after the day on which the change takes place, inform the AFRC of the change by written notice.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified particulars (指明詳情) means—(a)full name;(b)address of registered office;(c)telephone number; and(d)electronic mail address.

section.name: s20AAZZG
section.heading: Obligation to inform AFRC of cessation to comply with certain requirements

subsection.content: This section applies if a corporate practice ceases to comply with a requirement specified in section 20AAZX(2), (3), (4), (5) or (6) (requirement concerned).
The corporate practice must, within 14 days after the day on which the cessation begins, inform the AFRC of the cessation by written notice.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of the notice, the AFRC may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose any condition in relation to the registration of the corporate practice for the purpose of requiring the practice to comply with the requirement concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: record the condition in the AFRC register in the way it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The corporate practice must comply with the condition imposed by the AFRC within the period specified by the AFRC.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s20AAZZH
section.heading: Obligation to inform AFRC of proposed amendment to articles of association

subsection.content: This section applies if it is proposed to amend the articles of association of a corporate practice (proposal) at a meeting of the members of the practice (members’ meeting).
The corporate practice must inform the AFRC of the proposal by written notice.
The notice mentioned in subsection (2) must be sent to the AFRC no later than the day on which notice of the members’ meeting is given to the members of the corporate practice.
If the proposal is approved by passing a special resolution at the members’ meeting, the practice must inform the AFRC of the approval by written notice.
The notice mentioned in subsection (4) must be sent to the AFRC within 21 days beginning on the date on which the special resolution is passed.

subsection.leadIn: If a corporate practice fails to comply with the requirement specified in subsection (2) or (4), the AFRC may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the registration of the practice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the registration of the practice for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the registration of the practice under subsection (6), the AFRC must inform the practice of its decision by written notice.
The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Register of Certified Public Accountants (Practising), CPA Firms and Corporate Practices

section.name: s20AAZZI
section.heading: AFRC to establish and maintain register of certified public accountants (practising), CPA firms and corporate practices

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must establish and maintain, in a form it considers appropriate, a register of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: certified public accountants (practising);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: CPA firms; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: corporate practices.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, in relation to each certified public accountant (practising)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the accountant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the registered office of the accountant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the qualification because of which the practising certificate is issued to the accountant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other particulars the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, in relation to each CPA firm—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the firm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the registered office of the firm; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other particulars the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, in relation to each corporate practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the practice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the registered office of the practice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other particulars the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the AFRC register is kept in a documentary form—inspect the register free of charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the AFRC register is kept otherwise than in a documentary form—inspect a reproduction of any information recorded in the register in a legible form free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, at all reasonable times and on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3B, obtain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in, or an extract of, the AFRC register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the entry or extract certified by an authorized officer of the AFRC as a true copy of the entry or extract.

subsection.leadIn: A right under subsection (1) or (2) is only exercisable for enabling a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain whether the person is dealing with—

subparagraph.content: a certified public accountant (practising);
a CPA firm; or
a corporate practice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain the particulars of—

subparagraph.content: a certified public accountant (practising);
a CPA firm; or
a corporate practice.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a document purporting—

subparagraph.content: to be a copy of an entry in, or an extract of, the AFRC register; and
to be certified by an authorized officer of the AFRC as a true copy of the entry or extract,

paragraph.continued: is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless there is evidence to the contrary, on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document—

subparagraph.content: is presumed to be certified by an authorized officer of the AFRC;
is presumed to be a true copy of the entry or extract; and
is proof of its content.

subsection.content: The AFRC must, as far as practicable, make the AFRC register available to any person for inspection free of charge on the Internet.
A person commits an offence if the person falsifies or causes to be falsified the AFRC register.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s20AAZZL
section.heading: Prohibition on pretending to be or practising as certified public accountant (practising) etc.

subsection.content: A person who is not a certified public accountant (practising) must not pretend to be qualified to practise as a certified public accountant (practising).

A person who is not a certified public accountant (practising) must not take or use any name, initials, title, addition or description implying that the person is qualified to practise as a certified public accountant (practising).
A person who is not a certified public accountant (practising) must not, either directly or indirectly, practise as a certified public accountant (practising).

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) or (3),

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s20AAZZM
section.heading: Prohibition on signing audit report without practising certificate

subsection.content: A person must not sign an audit report unless the person is a certified public accountant (practising).
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s20AAZZN
section.heading: Prohibition on advertising etc. as certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm or taking certain descriptions

subsection.leadIn: A person that is not a certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: advertise or represent himself, herself or itself as being qualified to practise as a certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish that the person is qualified to practise as a certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: knowingly permit himself, herself or itself to be so advertised, represented or published.

subsection.leadIn: A person that is not a certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: take the description—

subparagraph.content: “certified public accountant (practising)”; or
“public accountant”; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: use the description mentioned in paragraph (a) in conjunction with—

subparagraph.content: the person’s name;
a name that the person may have assumed; or
a name by which the person may describe himself, herself or itself.

subsection.leadIn: A person that is not a certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm must not use in conjunction with the person’s name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the abbreviation “CPA (practising)”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the initials “PA”; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the characters—

subparagraph.content: “執業會計師”;
“註冊核數師”;
“核數師”; or
“審計師”.

subsection.leadIn: A person that is not a certified public accountant (practising) or CPA firm must not knowingly permit the use of, or use, in connection with the person’s business, trade, calling or profession—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the description mentioned in subsection (2)(a)(i) or (ii);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the abbreviation mentioned in subsection (3)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the initials mentioned in subsection (3)(b); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the characters mentioned in subsection (3)(c).

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1)(a) or (b), (2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes subsection (1)(c) or (4),

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s20AAZZO
section.heading: Prohibition on holding out as corporate practice or taking certain descriptions

subsection.content: A corporation that is not a corporate practice must not provide, offer to provide, or hold itself out as providing, any professional service that only a practice unit may lawfully provide.

subsection.leadIn: A corporation that is not a corporate practice must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: advertise or represent itself as being qualified to practise as a practice unit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish that it is qualified to practise as a practice unit; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: permit itself to be so advertised, represented or published.

subsection.leadIn: A corporation that is not a corporate practice must not use in conjunction with its name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the description “certified public accountant (practising)”; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the description “public accountant”.

subsection.leadIn: A corporation that is not a corporate practice must not use in conjunction with its name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the abbreviation “CPA (practising)”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the initials “PA”; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the characters—

subparagraph.content: “執業會計師”;
“註冊核數師”;
“核數師”; or
“審計師”.

subsection.leadIn: A corporation that is not a corporate practice must not permit the use of, or use, in connection with its business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the description mentioned in subsection (3)(a) or (b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the abbreviation mentioned in subsection (4)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the initials mentioned in subsection (4)(b); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the characters mentioned in subsection (4)(c).

subsection.leadIn: A corporation that is not a corporate practice must not include in, or use in conjunction with, its name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the description “certified public accountant” (other than as part of the description referred to in subsection (3)(a));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the initials “CPA” (other than as part of the abbreviation referred to in subsection (4)(a)); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the characters “會計師” (other than as part of the characters referred to in subsection (4)(c)(i)),

subsection.continued: with the intention of causing, or in a way that may reasonably cause, a person to believe that it is a practice unit.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes subsection (6),

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (7) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s20AAZZP
section.heading: Sections 20AAZZN and 20AAZZO do not apply to member of non-Hong Kong accountancy body

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who is a member of a non-Hong Kong accountancy body but is not a certified public accountant.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person uses a description or initials that the person is entitled to use under the constitution of a non-Hong Kong accountancy body of which the person is a member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by such use the person does not represent that the person is—

subparagraph.content: a certified public accountant; or
entitled to practise as a certified public accountant (practising), CPA firm or corporate practice,

subsection.continued: sections 20AAZZN and 20AAZZO do not apply in relation to such use.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: non-Hong Kong accountancy body (外地會計團體) means a body or institute of accountants outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s20AAZZQ
section.heading: Liability of officer of corporation for certain offences

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who commits an offence under section 20AAZZE(2), 20AAZZF(2), 20AAZZG(5) or 20AAZZO(7) is a corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is proved that the act or omission constituting the offence was that of an officer of the corporation,

subsection.continued: the officer also commits the offence.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under section 20AAZZE(2) or 20AAZZF(2) because of subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
A person who commits an offence under section 20AAZZG(5) or 20AAZZO(7) because of subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under this section (except in respect of the relevant offence) to establish that the person had a reasonable excuse for the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: The person is to be taken to have established that the person had a reasonable excuse for the act or omission if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sufficient evidence is adduced to raise an issue that the person had such a reasonable excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant offence (有關罪行) means an offence under section 20AAZZO(7) for the contravention of section 20AAZZO(6).

section.name: s20AAZZR
section.heading: Prohibition on holding appointment or rendering services and recovering fees etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person that is not a certified public accountant (practising), a CPA firm or a corporate practice must not hold any appointment or render any services, whether paid or unpaid, as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an auditor of a company within the meaning of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an auditor of accounts for the purposes of any other Ordinance.

subsection.content: The AFRC may, on application, exempt a person from the operation of subsection (1)(b).

A person is entitled to recover any fees, remuneration or expenses for, or in respect of, any appointment held or services rendered by the person as a certified public accountant (practising) or a corporate practice only if the person is a certified public accountant (practising) or a corporate practice (as appropriate).

section.name: s20AAZZS
section.heading: Division 5 does not prevent certain acts
section.leadIn: To avoid doubt, this Division does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prevent a person from—

subparagraph.content: describing himself or herself by any other designations, abbreviations, initials or characters that do not convey the impression that the person is entitled to practise as a certified public accountant (practising); or
acting as an auditor of a registered trade union within the meaning of the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332) with the approval of the Registrar of Trade Unions appointed under that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevent a member of a club, institution or association that is not carried on with a view to profit from acting as an auditor of the club, institution or association.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Registration and Recognition of PIE Auditors

section.name: s20A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: chief executive officer (行政總裁), in relation to a practice unit, means the person (by whatever name called) who is responsible (whether alone or jointly with others) for implementing the general strategy and general management of the business of the unit;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a company or body corporate incorporated in the Mainland of China; but

paragraph.name: b

section.def: managing board of partners (合夥人管理會), in relation to a practice unit, means a group of partners forming a board (by whatever name called) which is responsible for implementing the general strategy and general management of the business of the unit;

registered engagement quality control reviewer (註冊項目質素監控審視員), in relation to a registered PIE auditor, means an individual whose name is recorded in the PIE auditors register as an engagement quality control reviewer of the auditor;

registered quality control system responsible person (註冊質素監控制度負責人), in relation to a registered PIE auditor, means an individual whose name is recorded in the PIE auditors register as a quality control system responsible person of the auditor.

section.name: s20B
section.heading: Prohibition on undertaking and carrying out PIE engagement

subsection.content: A person must not undertake or carry out any PIE engagement unless the person is a registered PIE auditor.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a non-Hong Kong auditor. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 185)

section.name: s20C
section.heading: Prohibition on holding out as registered PIE auditor
section.content: A person must not hold the person out as a registered PIE auditor unless the person is registered as such an auditor under this Division.

section.name: s20D
section.heading: Prohibition on carrying out activity as engagement partner
section.content: A person must not carry out any activity as an engagement partner of a registered PIE auditor unless the person is a registered engagement partner of the auditor.

section.name: s20E
section.heading: Prohibition on carrying out activity as engagement quality control reviewer
section.content: A person must not carry out any activity as an engagement quality control reviewer of a registered PIE auditor unless the person is a registered engagement quality control reviewer of the auditor.

section.name: s20F
section.heading: Offences
section.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes section 20B, 20C, 20D or 20E commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, for a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, for a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: A practice unit may apply to the AFRC to be registered as a PIE auditor.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B.

subsection.leadIn: The application must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a list of all the applicant’s responsible persons;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a firm of certified public accountants (practising)—a list of all the applicant’s partners; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a corporate practice—a list of all the applicant’s directors.

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a registration application (PIE auditor). (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 21; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must not grant a registration application (PIE auditor) unless it is satisfied that— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 21; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a practice unit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant meets the requirement specified in subsection (3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the quality control system responsible person of the applicant is—

subparagraph.content: the chief executive officer of the applicant; or
a member of the managing board of partners of the applicant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: each responsible person of the applicant specified in the application is a fit and proper person to be a certified public accountant.

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a firm of certified public accountants (practising)—each partner of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be a certified public accountant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a corporate practice—each director of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be a certified public accountant.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the applicant for a registration application (PIE auditor) of its decision on the application by written notice; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to each responsible person of the applicant listed in the application.

subsection.content: If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 22)

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a practice unit as a PIE auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC grants the unit’s registration application (PIE auditor)—on the day specified in the notice from the AFRC under section 20I(1); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the registration takes effect. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 23)

subsection.content: The registration of a practice unit as a PIE auditor is renewable annually.
A registered PIE auditor may apply to the AFRC for renewal of its registration.
The application must be made no earlier than 3 months, and no later than 45 days, before the day on which the current registration expires.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B.

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a renewal application (PIE auditor registration). (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 25; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must not grant a renewal application (PIE auditor registration) unless it is satisfied that— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 25; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant continues to meet all the requirements specified in section 20H(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant meets the requirement specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: if the applicant was a corporate practice when the applicant was first registered—the applicant continues to be a corporate practice.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the applicant for a renewal application (PIE auditor registration) of its decision on the application by written notice; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to each registered responsible person of the applicant.

subsection.content: If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 26)

section.name: s20N
section.heading: Current registration remains in force until decision on renewal takes effect

subsection.content: This section applies if a renewal application (PIE auditor registration) has been made but the application is not finally determined before the expiry of the current registration. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 20J(1), the current registration remains in force until— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 27)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registration is renewed—the day on which the renewal takes effect under section 20O; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the day on which the refusal takes effect under Part 3C.

section.name: s20O
section.heading: Validity period of renewed registration
section.leadIn: The renewal of registration of a PIE auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC grants the auditor’s renewal application (PIE auditor registration)—on the day specified in the notice from the AFRC under section 20M(1); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the renewal takes effect.

subsection.content: An applicant for a registration application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor registration) must provide the AFRC with the information that the AFRC reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
In considering the application, the AFRC may have regard to any information in its possession (whether or not provided by the applicant).

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a person is a fit and proper person to be a certified public accountant, the AFRC must have regard to the following matters— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s professional qualification, knowledge, skills and experience;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s reputation, character, reliability and integrity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person’s financial status and solvency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether any disciplinary action has been taken against the person under this Ordinance or the PA Ordinance; and (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 30)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether the person has been convicted of any offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, this section only applies for the purposes of sections 20H and 20Y. (Added 41 of 2021 s. 30)

section.name: s20R
section.heading: Offences to provide false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with a registration application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor registration)— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the statement is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with a registration application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor registration)— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: omits a material particular from a statement with the result that the statement is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the material particular is omitted from the statement.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s20S
section.heading: AFRC may impose or amend conditions

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may impose any condition in relation to the registration of a PIE auditor that the AFRC considers appropriate— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 31)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time when it grants the registration application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor registration); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any other time when the registration is valid.

subsection.content: The AFRC may, at any time when the registration is valid, amend an existing condition by varying or revoking the condition. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC decides to impose or amend a condition in relation to the registration of a PIE auditor, the AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 31)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the auditor of its decision by written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to each registered responsible person of the auditor.

subsection.content: The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20T
section.heading: Registration may be revoked or suspended on non-disciplinary grounds

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must revoke the registration of a PIE auditor— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the auditor was a certified public accountant (practising) when the auditor was first registered—

subparagraph.content: if the auditor dies; or
if the auditor ceases to be a certified public accountant (practising);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the auditor was a firm of certified public accountants (practising) when the auditor was first registered—

subparagraph.content: if the auditor ceases to operate and the partnership is dissolved; or
if the auditor ceases to be a firm of certified public accountants (practising); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the auditor was a corporate practice when the auditor was first registered—

subparagraph.content: if the auditor has commenced to be wound up; or
if the auditor ceases to be a corporate practice.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may revoke or suspend the registration of a PIE auditor if— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the auditor requests the AFRC to do so; or (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 32)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the AFRC is satisfied that the auditor has been registered— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 32)

subparagraph.content: by mistake; or
in consequence of any misleading, false or fraudulent statement, declaration or representation, whether orally or in writing.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), the AFRC may suspend the registration of a PIE auditor for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 32)

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the registration of a PIE auditor under subsection (1) or (2), the AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the auditor of its decision by written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to each registered responsible person of the auditor.

subsection.content: The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20U
section.heading: Registered PIE auditor must have registered responsible persons

subsection.leadIn: A registered PIE auditor must ensure that it has, at all times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least one registered engagement partner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least one registered engagement quality control reviewer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at least one registered quality control system responsible person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person may be registered for one or more of the roles listed in that subsection.

Despite subsection (2), a registered PIE auditor must ensure that a person does not, in relation to a PIE engagement carried out by the auditor, act as both a registered engagement partner and a registered engagement quality control reviewer of the auditor.

section.name: s20V
section.heading: Registered PIE auditor must not authorize unregistered persons to carry out activity
section.content: A registered PIE auditor must not authorize a person, who is not a registered engagement partner, registered engagement quality control reviewer or registered quality control system responsible person of the auditor, to carry out any activity for the auditor as such a partner, reviewer or person.

section.name: s20W
section.heading: Registered PIE auditor must provide sufficient resources etc.

subsection.content: A registered PIE auditor must ensure that a registered quality control system responsible person is provided with sufficient resources and support to carry out the duties under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A registered quality control system responsible person must use the person’s best endeavours to ensure that the registered PIE auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has established and maintains a quality control system in relation to the PIE engagements carried out by the auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has established policies and procedures for monitoring the quality control system; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complies with the policies and procedures.

section.name: s20X
section.heading: Failure to meet certain requirements after registration

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a registered PIE auditor fails to meet a requirement specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 20H(2)(b), (c) or (d); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 20U(1).

subsection.content: The auditor must, within 7 days after the day on which the failure begins, inform the AFRC of the failure by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 33)
The auditor must, within 14 days after the day on which the written notice is issued to the AFRC, take steps to ensure that the requirement is met. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: If the auditor still fails to meet the requirement on the expiry of the 14-day period, the AFRC may— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the registration of the auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the registration of the auditor for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the registration of the auditor under subsection (4), the AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the auditor of its decision by written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to each registered responsible person of the auditor.

subsection.content: The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.
This section applies if a registered PIE auditor proposes to add the name of a person to the list of registered responsible persons of the auditor.
The auditor must, by written notice in the specified form, inform the AFRC of the proposed addition. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 34)

subsection.leadIn: The name of the person may be added to the list of registered responsible persons of the auditor if the AFRC is satisfied that— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 34)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a fit and proper person to be a certified public accountant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where the person is to be added to the list as a registered quality control system responsible person, the person also meets the requirement specified in section 20H(2)(c).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 34)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the auditor of its decision by written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to the person.

subsection.content: If the AFRC refuses to add the name of the person to the list of registered responsible persons of the auditor, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 34)

section.name: s20Z
section.heading: Registered PIE auditor to notify changes in particulars

subsection.content: If there is a change in any of the specified particulars of a registered PIE auditor or any of its registered responsible persons, the auditor must, within 14 days after the day on which the change takes place, inform the AFRC of the change by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 35)
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: full name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: business address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: telephone number; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: electronic mail address.

section.name: s20ZA
section.heading: Registered PIE auditor to notify changes in registered responsible persons, partners and directors

subsection.leadIn: A registered PIE auditor must, within 14 days after the day on which any of the following changes takes place, inform the AFRC of the change by written notice— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 36)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered responsible person of the auditor ceases to be a responsible person of the auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person becomes or ceases to be a partner or director of the auditor.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s20ZB
section.heading: Prohibition on undertaking and carrying out PIE engagement

subsection.leadIn: A non-Hong Kong auditor must not undertake any PIE engagement for a non-Hong Kong entity unless— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 186)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognition application (PIE auditor) has been made in relation to the auditor; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has been granted.

subsection.content: A non-Hong Kong auditor must not carry out any PIE engagement for a non-Hong Kong entity unless the auditor has been recognized as a PIE auditor of that entity under section 20ZI. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 186)
Subsections (1) and (2) do not prohibit a Mainland auditor recognized under section 20ZT from undertaking or carrying out a PIE engagement for a Mainland corporation.

section.name: s20ZC
section.heading: Prohibition on holding out as recognized PIE auditor
section.content: A person must not hold the person out as a recognized PIE auditor unless the person is recognized as such an auditor under this Division.

section.name: s20ZD
section.heading: Offences
section.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes section 20ZB or 20ZC commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, for a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, for a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: If a non-Hong Kong entity proposes to appoint a non-Hong Kong auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for it, the entity may apply to the AFRC to grant an approval-in-principle recognizing the auditor as a PIE auditor of the entity. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 187)

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B.

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a recognition application (PIE auditor). (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must not grant a recognition application (PIE auditor) unless it is satisfied that— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Securities and Futures Commission or the HKEC has, or both of them have, as the case requires—

subparagraph.content: provided a statement of no objection to the applicant for appointing a non-Hong Kong auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for the applicant; and
not withdrawn the statement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the non-Hong Kong auditor specified in the application— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 188)

subparagraph.content: is a member of an accountancy body that is a member of the International Federation of Accountants; and
is subject to the regulation of a non-Hong Kong regulatory organization recognized by the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the non-Hong Kong auditor has adequate resources and possesses the capability to carry out a PIE engagement for the applicant. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 188)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may recognize a non-Hong Kong regulatory organization for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii) if it is satisfied that— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105; 31 of 2025 s. 188)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the organization performs a function that is similar to a function of the AFRC under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the organization is composed of a majority of persons who are independent of the accountancy profession.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the applicant for a recognition application (PIE auditor) of its decision on the application by written notice; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to the non-Hong Kong auditor specified in the application. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 189)

subsection.content: If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

If a recognition application (PIE auditor) made by a non-Hong Kong entity is granted, an approval-in-principle is granted by the AFRC recognizing the non-Hong Kong auditor specified in the application as a PIE auditor of the entity. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022; 31 of 2025 s. 190)

subsection.leadIn: The approval-in-principle granted in relation to the recognition application (PIE auditor) is valid for a 6-month period beginning on— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the AFRC grants the application—the day specified in the notice from the AFRC under section 20ZG(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—the day when the reversal of decision takes effect.

section.name: s20ZI
section.heading: Non-Hong Kong auditors recognized as PIE auditors on undertaking PIE engagements

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), after the approval-in-principle is granted by the AFRC in relation to a recognition application (PIE auditor), the non-Hong Kong entity may appoint the non-Hong Kong auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for it. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105; L.N. 66 of 2022)

If the non-Hong Kong auditor undertakes the PIE engagement, the non-Hong Kong entity must, within 14 days after the date of undertaking, inform the AFRC of that fact by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)
Subject to subsection (4), the non-Hong Kong auditor is recognized as a PIE auditor of the non-Hong Kong entity when the auditor undertakes the PIE engagement.

subsection.leadIn: If, by the end of the 6-month period during which the approval-in-principle granted in relation to the recognition application (PIE auditor) is valid— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the non-Hong Kong entity has not appointed the non-Hong Kong auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the entity has appointed the auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for it but the auditor has not undertaken the engagement,

subsection.continued: the entity must make a fresh recognition application (PIE auditor) in relation to the auditor if the entity subsequently proposes to so appoint the auditor. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The recognition of a non-Hong Kong auditor as a PIE auditor of a non-Hong Kong entity— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 192)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect when the auditor undertakes a PIE engagement for the entity within the 6-month period during which the relevant approval-in-principle is valid under section 20ZH(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the recognition takes effect. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 37)

subsection.content: The recognition of a non-Hong Kong auditor as a PIE auditor is renewable annually. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 192)
A non-Hong Kong entity that has appointed a recognized PIE auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for it may apply to the AFRC for renewal of the recognition. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 193)
The application must be made no earlier than 3 months, and no later than 45 days, before the day on which the current recognition expires.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the fee specified in Schedule 3B.

subsection.content: The AFRC may grant or refuse a renewal application (PIE auditor recognition).

The AFRC must not grant a renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) unless it is satisfied that all the requirements specified in section 20ZF(2) continue to be met in relation to the recognized PIE auditor.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the applicant for a renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) of its decision on the application by written notice; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to the recognized PIE auditor specified in the application.

subsection.content: If the AFRC refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

section.name: s20ZN
section.heading: Current recognition remains in force until decision on renewal takes effect

subsection.content: This section applies if a renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) has been made but the application is not finally determined before the expiry of the current recognition. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 20ZJ(1), the current recognition remains in force until— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 38)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the recognition is renewed—the day on which the renewal takes effect under section 20ZO; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the day on which the refusal takes effect under Part 3C.

section.name: s20ZO
section.heading: Validity period of renewed recognition
section.leadIn: The renewal of recognition of a PIE auditor of a non-Hong Kong entity— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 194)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: takes effect—

subparagraph.content: if the AFRC grants the entity’s renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) in relation to the auditor—on the day specified in the notice from the AFRC under section 20ZM(1); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
if the AFRC refuses the application but the decision is reversed by a review or appeal under Part 3C—on the day when the reversal of decision takes effect; and (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on 31 December of the year in which the renewal takes effect.

subsection.content: An applicant for a recognition application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) must provide the AFRC with the information that the AFRC reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
In considering the application, the AFRC may have regard to any information in its possession (whether or not provided by the applicant).

section.name: s20ZQ
section.heading: Offences to provide false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with a recognition application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor recognition)— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the statement is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with a recognition application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor recognition)— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: omits a material particular from a statement with the result that the statement is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the material particular is omitted from the statement.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s20ZR
section.heading: AFRC may impose or amend conditions

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may impose any condition in relation to the recognition of a PIE auditor that the AFRC considers appropriate— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time when it grants the recognition application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor recognition); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any other time when the recognition is valid.

subsection.content: The AFRC may, at any time when the recognition is valid, amend an existing condition by varying or revoking the condition. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 39)
