subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC decides to impose or amend a condition in relation to the recognition of a PIE auditor, the AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the non-Hong Kong entity, being the applicant for the recognition application (PIE auditor) or renewal application (PIE auditor recognition) in relation to the auditor, of its decision by written notice; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022; 31 of 2025 s. 195)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to the auditor.

subsection.content: The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20ZS
section.heading: Recognition may be revoked or suspended on non-disciplinary grounds

subsection.content: The AFRC must revoke the recognition of a non-Hong Kong auditor as a PIE auditor of a non-Hong Kong entity if the appointment of the auditor for carrying out a PIE engagement for the entity is terminated. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 196)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may revoke or suspend the recognition of a non-Hong Kong auditor as a PIE auditor of a non-Hong Kong entity if— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105; 31 of 2025 s. 196)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the AFRC is satisfied that the auditor has been recognized—

subparagraph.content: by mistake; or
in consequence of any misleading, false or fraudulent statement, declaration or representation, whether orally or in writing; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission or the HKEC, as the case requires, has withdrawn the statement of no objection referred to in section 20ZF(2)(a).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), the AFRC may suspend the recognition of a PIE auditor for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the recognition of a non-Hong Kong auditor as a PIE auditor of a non-Hong Kong entity under subsection (1) or (2), the AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105; 31 of 2025 s. 196)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the entity of its decision by written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to the auditor.

subsection.content: The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s20ZT
section.heading: Recognition of Mainland auditors endorsed in accordance with mutual recognition agreement

subsection.content: The AFRC must, without a recognition application (PIE auditor) having been made in relation to a Mainland auditor, recognize the auditor as a PIE auditor if all the conditions specified in subsection (2) are satisfied. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a mutual recognition agreement is in force;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the endorsement has not been withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: A Mainland auditor recognized under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may only carry out PIE engagements for the Mainland corporations listed in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must carry them out in accordance with—

subparagraph.content: the China Accounting Standards for Business Enterprises; or
the Mainland Auditing Standards.

subsection.content: Subdivisions 2, 3, 4 and 5, and sections 20ZU and 20ZV, do not apply to a Mainland auditor recognized under subsection (1).

The AFRC must revoke the recognition of a Mainland auditor under subsection (1) if any of the conditions specified in subsection (2) is no longer satisfied in relation to the auditor. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)
If the AFRC decides to revoke the recognition of a Mainland auditor under subsection (5), the AFRC must inform the auditor of its decision by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)
The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: mutual recognition agreement (相互認可協議) means an agreement between the Mainland of China and Hong Kong for mutual recognition of qualified auditors from either jurisdiction (home jurisdiction) to act as auditors of corporations incorporated in the home jurisdiction and listed in the other jurisdiction.

section.name: s20ZU
section.heading: Non-Hong Kong entity to notify termination of appointment of recognized PIE auditors

subsection.content: This section applies if a non-Hong Kong entity has appointed a recognized PIE auditor to carry out a PIE engagement for it. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 197)
If the appointment is terminated, the entity must, within 14 days after the date of termination, inform the AFRC of the termination by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s20ZUA
section.heading: Supplemental provision for section 20ZU: where non-Hong Kong entity becomes a re-domiciled company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong entity becomes a re-domiciled company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the entity is required, but has yet to, comply with section 20ZU(2).

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the entity is required to comply with section 20ZU(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 20ZU(3) applies in relation to a non-compliance with section 20ZU(2),

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the entity was still a non-Hong Kong entity.

section.name: s20ZV
section.heading: Failure to meet certain requirements after recognition

subsection.content: This section applies if a recognized PIE auditor fails to meet a requirement specified in section 20ZF(2)(b) or (c).
The auditor must, within 7 days after the day on which the failure begins, inform the AFRC of the failure by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)
The auditor must, within 14 days after the day on which the written notice is issued to the AFRC, take steps to ensure that the requirement is met. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

subsection.leadIn: If the auditor still fails to meet the requirement on the expiry of the 14-day period, the AFRC may— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the recognition of the auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the recognition of the auditor for a period of time, or until the occurrence of an event, that the AFRC considers appropriate. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC decides to revoke or suspend the recognition of the auditor under subsection (4), the AFRC must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the auditor of its decision by written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a copy of the notice to the non-Hong Kong entity concerned. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 199)

subsection.content: The notice must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s20ZW
section.heading: Recognized PIE auditor to notify changes in particulars

subsection.content: If there is a change in any of the specified particulars of a recognized PIE auditor, the auditor must, within 14 days after the day on which the change takes place, inform the AFRC of the change by written notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: full name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: business address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: telephone number; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: electronic mail address.

section.name: s20ZX
section.heading: AFRC to establish and maintain register of PIE auditors

subsection.content: The AFRC must establish and maintain a register of PIE auditors in a form the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, in relation to each registered PIE auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the full name of—

subparagraph.content: the auditor; and
each registered responsible person of the auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the business address of the auditor;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conditions imposed by the AFRC in relation to the registration of the auditor (including any condition relating to the registered responsible persons of the auditor), if any;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the day on which the registration of the auditor expires;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a record of—

subparagraph.content: the sanctions imposed or actions taken under Division 2 or 3 of Part 3B (except a private reprimand); and
the orders made under section 35 of the PA Ordinance as in force before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date,

paragraph.continued: in relation to the auditor, or any registered responsible person of the auditor, within the last 5 years, if any; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other particulars the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register must contain, in relation to each recognized PIE auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of the auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the business address of the auditor;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the day on which the recognition of the auditor expires, if applicable;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a record of the sanctions imposed or actions taken under Division 2 or 3 of Part 3B (except a private reprimand) in relation to the auditor within the last 5 years, if any; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other particulars the AFRC considers appropriate.

section.name: s20ZY
section.heading: Inspection of PIE auditors register etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the PIE auditors register is kept in a documentary form—inspect the register free of charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the register is kept otherwise than in a documentary form—inspect a reproduction of any information recorded in the register in a legible form free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, at all reasonable times and on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 3B, obtain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in, or an extract of, the PIE auditors register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the entry or extract certified by an authorized officer of the AFRC as a true copy of the entry or extract.

subsection.leadIn: A right under subsection (1) or (2) is only exercisable for enabling a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain whether the person is dealing with, in matters of or connected with a PIE engagement—

subparagraph.content: a registered PIE auditor;
a registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; or
a recognized PIE auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain the particulars of—

subparagraph.content: a registered PIE auditor;
a registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; or
a recognized PIE auditor.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a document purporting—

subparagraph.content: to be a copy of an entry in, or an extract of, the PIE auditors register; and
to be certified by an authorized officer of the AFRC as a true copy of the entry or extract,

paragraph.continued: is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless there is evidence to the contrary, on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document—

subparagraph.content: is presumed to be certified by an authorized officer of the AFRC;
is presumed to be a true copy of the entry or extract; and
is proof of its contents.

subsection.content: The AFRC must, as far as practicable, make the PIE auditors register available to any person for inspection free of charge on the Internet.

part.name: P3AA
part.heading: Inspection and Investigation in relation to Practice Units etc.

section.name: s20ZZ
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: inspection report (查察報告) means a report prepared by a CPA inspector under section 20ZZD(1);
investigation report (調查報告) means a report prepared by a CPA investigator under section 20ZZN(1) or (2).

division.name: D2
division.heading: Inspection in relation to Practice Units

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in writing, appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee of the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, any other person,

subsection.continued: as a CPA inspector for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A CPA inspector must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of an accountancy body that is a member of the International Federation of Accountants.

subsection.content: The AFRC must provide a CPA inspector with a copy of the appointment.

section.name: s20ZZB
section.heading: AFRC may direct inspection to be carried out for determining observance etc.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a PAO professional standard in relation to which an inspection under this Division is to be carried out;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), direct a CPA inspector to carry out an inspection in relation to a practice unit for the purpose of determining whether the unit has observed, maintained or applied the PAO professional standard; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determine the practices and procedures to be followed for an inspection under this Division.

subsection.content: A direction under subsection (1)(b) must not require an inspection to be carried out in relation to the PIE engagements completed by a PIE auditor on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date.
The AFRC must provide the CPA inspector with a copy of its direction.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an inspection under this Division, a CPA inspector may require a person specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to produce to the CPA inspector, or give the CPA inspector access to, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any specified document in the person’s possession, or under the person’s control, that the CPA inspector has reasonable cause to believe to be relevant to the inspection (required document);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give to the CPA inspector such explanation or further particulars in respect of a required document as the CPA inspector specifies; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to give to the CPA inspector all assistance in connection with the inspection that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1) is any of the following persons whom the CPA inspector has reasonable cause to believe to be in possession of, or in control of, a required document—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: a person employed by, or whose services are engaged by, the unit concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A CPA inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect, examine or make copies of a required document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take any abstract of, or extract from, a required document.

subsection.content: A CPA inspector exercising a power under this section must, if so requested by a person affected by the exercise, produce for inspection by the person a copy of the appointment provided to the CPA inspector under section 20ZZA(3).
Nothing in this section is to be taken to compel the production by a person of a record or document containing privileged communication by or to a legal practitioner in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified document (指明文件) means any record or document specified by a CPA inspector, or any record or document that is of a class or description specified by a CPA inspector, for the purposes of subsection (1).

section.name: s20ZZD
section.heading: Report for inspection in relation to practice units

subsection.leadIn: A CPA inspector who carries out an inspection under this Division must prepare and submit to the AFRC a written report in relation to the inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the conclusion of the inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the AFRC—at any other stage of the inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Before submitting an inspection report to the AFRC, the CPA inspector must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: send a dated draft of the report to—

subparagraph.content: the practice unit concerned; and
any other person named in the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give every person to whom the draft is sent under paragraph (a) a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: After submitting an inspection report to the AFRC, the CPA inspector must send a copy of the report to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the practice unit concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person named in the report.

subsection.leadIn: When sending a draft or copy of the inspection report under this section, the CPA inspector must send it by registered post—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the practice unit concerned—to the registered office of the unit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other person named in the draft or report—to the last known address of the person.

section.name: s20ZZE
section.heading: AFRC’s power to take follow-up action after inspection in relation to practice units

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, having regard to an inspection report in relation to a practice unit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decide no follow-up action is required;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the unit to take a measure or corrective action regarding compliance with a PAO professional standard;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: initiate an investigation under section 20ZZH; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: impose a sanction on, or take an action in relation to, the unit or any certified public accountant to which the inspection relates under section 37CA or 37I(1A).

subsection.content: A period specified under subsection (1)(c) must not commence earlier than 6 months after the date of the direction concerned.

section.name: s20ZZF
section.heading: Change in composition of practice unit

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any change in the composition of a practice unit whenever occurring; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any inspection under this Division whenever conducted.

subsection.content: If a change in the composition of a practice unit occurs, a reference in this Division to a practice unit includes the unit after the change.
A power under this Division is exercisable in relation to a practice unit despite any change in the composition of the unit.

subsection.leadIn: A change in the composition of a practice unit does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any right, obligation or liability acquired or incurred by, or accrued to, the unit under this Division before the change; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any inspection or further inspection in relation to the unit under this Division.

subsection.content: Any inspection or further inspection under this Division may be carried out and continued in relation to a practice unit despite any change or further changes in the composition of the unit.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a change in the composition of a practice unit is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a change in the name of the unit, whether or not following or in consequence of an event described in paragraph (b), (c) or (d);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: if the unit is a firm of certified public accountants (practising)—a change in the persons who comprise the partners of the firm, but only if at least one of the partners of the firm before the change is a partner of the firm after the change; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the unit is a corporate practice—a change in the persons who comprise the directors of the practice.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Investigation in relation to Professional Persons

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in writing, appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee of the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, any other person,

subsection.continued: as a CPA investigator for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The AFRC must provide a CPA investigator with a copy of the appointment.

section.name: s20ZZH
section.heading: AFRC may direct investigation to be carried out in relation to professional persons

subsection.content: This section applies if the AFRC, for considering whether to impose a sanction under section 37CA, has reason to inquire into whether a professional person, or a person while being a professional person, has committed a professional irregularity within the meaning of section 3B.
The AFRC may direct a CPA investigator to carry out an investigation into the possible professional irregularity.

subsection.leadIn: A direction under subsection (2) must not require an investigation to be carried out if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to be investigated is or was a PIE auditor, a non-PIE auditor or a registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investigation relates to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement completed by the auditor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the professional irregularity to be investigated is a practice irregularity within the meaning of section 4.

subsection.content: The AFRC must provide the CPA investigator with a copy of its direction.

section.name: s20ZZI
section.heading: AFRC may direct investigation in relation to professional persons to be suspended

subsection.content: The AFRC may direct a CPA investigator to suspend an investigation under this Division for a period of time the AFRC considers appropriate.
The AFRC must provide the CPA investigator with a copy of its direction.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an investigation under this Division, a CPA investigator may require a person specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to produce to the CPA investigator, or give the CPA investigator access to, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any specified document in the person’s possession, or under the person’s control, that the CPA investigator has reasonable cause to believe to be relevant to the investigation (required document);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give to the CPA investigator such explanation or further particulars in respect of a required document as the CPA investigator specifies; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to give to the CPA investigator all assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1) is any of the following persons whom the CPA investigator has reasonable cause to believe to be in possession of, or in control of, a required document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a professional person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is—

subparagraph.content: an employee or former employee of a professional person; and
a student registered with the HKICPA;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the investigation relates to a practice unit—an employee or former employee of the unit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the investigation relates to a certified public accountant—the employer or former employer (if any) of the accountant.

subsection.leadIn: A CPA investigator may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect, examine or make copies of a required document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take any abstract of, or extract from, a required document.

subsection.content: A CPA investigator exercising a power under this section must, if so requested by a person affected by the exercise, produce for inspection by the person a copy of the appointment provided to the CPA investigator under section 20ZZG(2).
Nothing in this section is to be taken to compel the production by a person of a record or document containing privileged communication by or to a legal practitioner in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified document (指明文件) means any record or document specified by a CPA investigator, or any record or document that is of a class or description specified by a CPA investigator, for the purposes of subsection (1).

section.name: s20ZZK
section.heading: AFRC to inform certain bodies of investigation in relation to professional persons

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the AFRC directs a CPA investigator to carry out an investigation under section 20ZZH; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investigation relates to the provision of services to any of the persons specified in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The AFRC must give a written notice to the specified enforcement agency referred to in subsection (4), informing it that the investigation is to be carried out.

subsection.leadIn: The persons specified for subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person that—

subparagraph.content: is an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.leadIn: to the AFRC’s knowledge—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is a controller of an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has as its controller an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person that is an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a person that is—

subparagraph.content: a licensed person within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or
a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person that is an approved trustee within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485).

subsection.leadIn: The notice is to be given to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a person referred to in subsection (3)(a)—the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a person referred to in subsection (3)(b)—the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a person referred to in subsection (3)(c)—the Securities and Futures Commission;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a person referred to in subsection (3)(d)—the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority.

section.name: s20ZZL
section.heading: CPA investigator to consult before imposing requirements under section 20ZZJ
section.leadIn: A CPA investigator must not impose a requirement on a person under section 20ZZJ unless, before doing so, the CPA investigator has consulted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person—

subparagraph.content: is an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.leadIn: to the AFRC’s knowledge—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is a controller of an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has as its controller an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized institution,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41)—the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is—

subparagraph.content: a licensed person within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or
a responsible person of a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 of that Ordinance,

paragraph.continued: the Securities and Futures Commission; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person is an approved trustee within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485)—the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority.

section.name: s20ZZM
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings after investigation in relation to professional persons

subsection.content: If a CPA investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars under section 20ZZJ, the CPA investigator must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of the requirement and of the explanation or particulars.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a CPA investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars under section 20ZZJ; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the explanation or particulars might tend to incriminate the person and the person claims this before giving the explanation or particulars,

subsection.continued: the requirement, as well as the explanation or particulars, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which the person is charged with an offence under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200) in relation to the explanation or particulars.

section.name: s20ZZN
section.heading: Report for investigation in relation to professional persons

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the completion of an investigation under this Division, the CPA investigator must prepare and submit to the AFRC a written report in relation to the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: The CPA investigator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may prepare an interim report in relation to the investigation if the CPA investigator considers it appropriate to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the AFRC—must prepare an interim report in relation to the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: Before submitting an investigation report to the AFRC, the CPA investigator must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: send a dated draft of the report to—

subparagraph.content: the person investigated; and
any other person named in the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give every person to whom the draft is sent under paragraph (a) a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adopt the investigation report submitted by the CPA investigator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish or otherwise disclose the report or any part of it.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether to publish or otherwise disclose an investigation report or any part of it, the AFRC must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the publication or disclosure may adversely affect any of the following proceedings that have been, or are likely to be, instituted—

subparagraph.content: any proceedings under Part 3C;
any criminal proceedings before a court or magistrate;
any proceedings before a tribunal established by or under an enactment;
any proceedings under section 41 of the PA Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the publication or disclosure may adversely affect any person named in the report; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the publication or disclosure would be in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a copy of an investigation report adopted under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be certified by the chairperson of the AFRC as a true copy of such a report,

subsection.continued: is admissible on its production, without further proof, as evidence of the facts stated in the report in any of the proceedings specified in subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: The proceedings are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings under Part 3C;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: civil proceedings before a court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: proceedings before a tribunal established by or under an enactment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: proceedings under section 41 of the PA Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: proceedings before a Disciplinary Committee constituted under section 33(3) of the PA Ordinance as in force immediately before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date.

section.name: s20ZZO
section.heading: Action by AFRC in relation to investigation under Division 3 of Part 3AA

subsection.content: This section applies if an investigation report is submitted to the AFRC under section 20ZZN.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in relation to the investigation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: close the case without further action; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a sanction on, or take an action in relation to, the person investigated under section 37CA or 37I(1A).

subsection.content: In exercising a power under subsection (2), the AFRC must have regard to the investigation report.

As soon as practicable after deciding to exercise a power under subsection (2), the AFRC must issue a written notice of the decision to the person investigated, unless the AFRC is satisfied that the notification may prejudice an action by the AFRC, or a specified body, relating to the investigation.

part.name: P3A
part.heading: Inspection and Investigation in relation to PIE Auditors, Non-PIE Auditors, etc.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: inspection report (查察報告) means a report prepared by an FR inspector under section 21G(1); (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
investigation report (調查報告) means a report prepared by an FR investigator under section 31A(1) or (2). (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

division.name: D2
division.heading: Inspection in relation to PIE Auditors

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in writing, appoint— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee of the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, any other person,

subsection.continued: as an FR inspector for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An FR inspector must be— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of an accountancy body that is a member of the International Federation of Accountants.

subsection.content: The AFRC must provide an FR inspector with a copy of the appointment.

section.name: s21B
section.heading: AFRC may direct inspection to be carried out for ascertaining compliance

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may direct an FR inspector to carry out an inspection in relation to the PIE engagements completed by a PIE auditor on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date for the purpose of ascertaining whether the auditor has complied with, or is likely to be able to comply with— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 44; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a professional standard.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in relation to an inspection under this Division— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 44)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a professional standard the compliance with which is to be ascertained in the inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the practices and procedures to be followed for the inspection.

subsection.content: The AFRC must provide the FR inspector with a copy of its direction. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 44; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an inspection under this Division, an FR inspector may, at any reasonable time, exercise any of the following powers in relation to a PIE auditor— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter any business premises of the auditor;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: make inquiries of the auditor or a person specified in subsection (4)—

subparagraph.content: concerning a record or document referred to in paragraph (b); or
concerning an activity that was carried out in the course of, or that may affect, a PIE engagement.

subsection.leadIn: In exercising a power under subsection (1)(b) or (c), the FR inspector may require the auditor or a person specified in subsection (4)— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to give the FR inspector access to a record or document referred to in subsection (1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce to the FR inspector, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, a record or document referred to in subsection (1)(b); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: to answer any question—

subparagraph.content: concerning an activity that was carried out in the course of, or that may affect, a PIE engagement. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.content: The power under subsection (1)(c) or (2) is not exercisable in relation to a person specified in subsection (4) unless the FR inspector has reasonable cause to believe that the information, record or document being sought cannot be obtained by exercising the power in relation to the auditor. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1)(c) or (2) is a person whom the FR inspector has reasonable cause to believe— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have the information being sought for the inspection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be in possession of any record or document being sought for the inspection.

section.name: s21D
section.heading: FR inspector may require answer to be verified by statutory declaration

subsection.content: If a person gives an answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 21C, the FR inspector may, by written notice, require the person to verify the answer by a statutory declaration within the time specified in the notice.

If a person does not give an answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 21C for the reason that the information concerned is not within the person’s knowledge or possession, the FR inspector may, by written notice, require the person to verify that fact and reason by a statutory declaration within the time specified in the notice.
A statutory declaration under subsection (1) or (2) may be made before the FR inspector and, for that purpose, the FR inspector is to have full power to administer the statutory declaration.

section.name: s21E
section.heading: AFRC may require information for determining frequency of inspection etc.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, by written notice, require a PIE auditor to provide any information specified in subsection (2) for— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determining the frequency at which an inspection under this Division is to be carried out in relation to the auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the professional standard the compliance with which is to be ascertained in an inspection under this Division; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: determining the practices and procedures to be followed for an inspection under this Division.

subsection.leadIn: The information is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the full name of the PIEs that have appointed the auditor to undertake PIE engagements; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other information relating to the auditor required by the AFRC.

subsection.content: The PIE auditor must provide the required information within the time and in the form specified in the notice.
A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a specified requirement.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with a specified requirement.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a specified requirement, the person produces a record or document, or gives an answer, that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the record, document or answer is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in purported compliance with a specified requirement, the person, with intent to defraud, produces a record or document, or gives an answer, that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or allows another person to fail to comply with a specified requirement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: causes or allows another person, in purported compliance with a specified requirement, to produce a record or document, or give an answer, that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in relation to a particular conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 32(2)(b) in relation to the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those proceedings remain pending, or because of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against the person under section 32(2)(b) in relation to the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (4) or (5) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedRequirement
def.leadIn: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 21C(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 21D(1) or (2).

section.name: s21G
section.heading: Report for inspection in relation to PIE engagements

subsection.leadIn: An FR inspector who carries out an inspection under this Division must prepare and submit to the AFRC a written report in relation to the inspection— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 46; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the conclusion of the inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the AFRC, at any other stage of the inspection. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 46)

subsection.leadIn: Before submitting an inspection report to the AFRC, the FR inspector must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 46; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: send a dated draft of the report to—

subparagraph.content: the PIE auditor concerned; and
any other person named in the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the auditor and the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: After submitting an inspection report to the AFRC, the FR inspector must send a copy of the report to— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 46; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the PIE auditor concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person named in the report.

subsection.leadIn: When sending a draft or copy of the inspection report under this section, the FR inspector must send it by registered post to— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the PIE auditor concerned—the registered office of the auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other person named in the draft or report—the last known address of the person.

section.name: s21H
section.heading: AFRC’s power to take follow-up action after inspection in relation to PIE engagements
section.leadIn: The AFRC may, having regard to an inspection report in relation to a PIE auditor— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 47)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decide no follow-up action is required;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require the auditor or, if a registered responsible person of the auditor is named in the report, the person to take a measure or corrective action regarding compliance with—

subparagraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance; or
a professional standard;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: direct an FR inspector to carry out a further inspection under this Division in relation to the auditor within a specified period which must not commence earlier than 6 months after the date of the direction; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 47; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: initiate an investigation in relation to the auditor or, if applicable, the registered responsible person;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: impose a sanction on, or take an action in relation to, the auditor or, if applicable, the registered responsible person under section 37D, 37E, 37F or 37I(1); or (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 47)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: take any other follow-up action in accordance with this Ordinance that the AFRC considers appropriate. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 47)

division.name: D3
division.heading: Investigation in relation to PIE Auditors, Non-PIE Auditors, etc.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Audit Investigation Board and FR Investigators

subsection.content: There is established by this section a board called the “Audit Investigation Board” in English and “審計調查委員會” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The Investigation Board is to consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the AFRC, as an ex officio member and chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least one other member appointed by the AFRC. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 28; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

subsection.content: The AFRC must give notice of an appointment under subsection (2)(b) by notice published in the Gazette. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 28; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

subsection.leadIn: The Investigation Board may perform any of its functions, and its proceedings are valid, despite—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vacancy in the membership of the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a defect in the appointment or qualification of a person purporting to be a member of the Board; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a minor irregularity in the convening of any meeting of the Board.

subsection.content: Schedule 4 has effect with respect to the Investigation Board and its members.

section.name: s22A
section.heading: AFRC may appoint FR investigators

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in writing, appoint— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee of the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, any other person,

subsection.continued: as an FR investigator for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The AFRC must provide the appointed FR investigator with a copy of the appointment.

section.sourceNote: (Added 3 of 2019 s. 29. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 48; L.N. 66 of 2022)

section.name: s23
section.heading: AFRC may direct investigation to be carried out in relation to PIE auditors etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the AFRC— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 49)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has reasonable cause to believe that a PIE auditor has carried out a PIE engagement completed on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date in a way that is not in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reasonable cause to believe that a provision of this Ordinance may have been contravened by a PIE auditor or registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for considering whether to impose a sanction under section 37D, 37E or 37F, has reason to inquire into whether a PIE auditor or registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor, or a person while being such an auditor or responsible person, has or had committed FR misconduct.

subsection.content: The AFRC may direct an FR investigator to carry out an investigation into the way in which the PIE engagement was carried out, or into the possible contravention or FR misconduct.
The AFRC must provide the FR investigator with a copy of its direction.

section.sourceNote: (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 31. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 49; L.N. 66 of 2022)

section.name: s23A
section.heading: AFRC may direct investigation to be carried out in relation to non-PIE auditors

subsection.content: If the AFRC has reasonable cause to believe that a non-PIE auditor has or had committed a practice irregularity within the meaning of section 4, the AFRC may direct an FR investigator to carry out an investigation into the possible irregularity.
The AFRC must provide the FR investigator with a copy of its direction.

section.sourceNote: (Added 3 of 2019 s. 32. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 50; L.N. 66 of 2022)

section.name: s23B
section.heading: AFRC may direct investigation in relation to PIE auditors etc. to be suspended

subsection.content: The AFRC may direct an FR investigator to suspend an investigation under this Division for a period of time the AFRC considers appropriate. (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 51)
The AFRC must provide the FR investigator with a copy of its direction. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 51)

section.name: s24
section.heading: AFRC to inform certain bodies of investigation in relation to PIE auditors etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the AFRC directs an FR investigator to carry out an investigation under section 23 or 23A; and (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 52; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investigation relates to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement completed on or after the 2019 Ordinance commencement date for a listed entity specified in subsection (2). (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 33)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The AFRC must give a written notice to the specified enforcement agency referred to in subsection (3), informing it that the investigation is to be carried out. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 33. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 52)

subsection.leadIn: A specified listed entity is— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a listed entity that— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: to the AFRC’s knowledge— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 33; 41 of 2021 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is a controller of an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has as its controller an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a listed entity that is an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 149; 3 of 2019 s. 33)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a listed entity that is— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a licensed person within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a listed entity that is an approved trustee within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485). (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The notice is to be given to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a listed entity that falls within subsection (2)(a), the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a listed entity that falls within subsection (2)(b), the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a listed entity that falls within subsection (2)(c), the Securities and Futures Commission;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a listed entity that falls within subsection (2)(d), the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a reference to an engagement completed for a listed entity includes an engagement completed for the entity in preparation for its listing. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an investigation under this Division, an FR investigator may require a person specified in subsection (2)— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to produce, within the time and at the place the FR investigator requires in writing, any record or document specified by the FR investigator that— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.content: is or may be relevant to the investigation; and
is in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give an explanation or further particulars in relation to a record or document produced;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to attend before the FR investigator at the time and place the FR investigator requires in writing, and to answer a question relating to any matter under investigation that may be raised by the FR investigator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to answer in writing, within the time the FR investigator requires in writing, a written question relating to any matter under investigation that may be raised by the FR investigator; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to give the FR investigator all other assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is relevant to the matter that an FR investigator is directed to investigate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom an FR investigator has reasonable cause to believe— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.content: to be in possession of a record or document that contains, or is likely to contain, information relevant to the investigation; or
to be otherwise in possession of the information.

section.name: s26
section.heading: FR investigator may require explanation etc. to be verified by statutory declaration

subsection.content: If a person gives any explanation, further particulars or answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 25(1), the FR investigator may, by written notice, require the person to verify the explanation, particulars or answer by a statutory declaration within the time specified in the notice.

If a person does not give any explanation, further particulars or answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 25(1) for the reason that the information concerned is not within the person’s knowledge or possession, the FR investigator may, by written notice, require the person to verify that fact and reason by a statutory declaration within the time specified in the notice.
A statutory declaration under subsection (1) or (2) may be made before the FR investigator and, for that purpose, the FR investigator is to have full power to administer the statutory declaration.

section.name: s29
section.heading: FR investigator to consult before imposing certain requirements under sections 25 and 26
section.leadIn: An FR investigator must not impose a requirement on a person under section 25 or 26 unless, before doing so, the FR investigator has consulted— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 38; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: to the AFRC’s knowledge— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 38; 41 of 2021 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is a controller of an authorized institution;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has as its controller an authorized institution; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized institution,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), the Insurance Authority; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 150)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a licensed person within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a responsible person of a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 of that Ordinance,

paragraph.continued: the Securities and Futures Commission; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person is an approved trustee within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485), the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings after investigation in relation to PIE auditors etc.

subsection.content: If an FR investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars, or to answer a question, under section 25, the FR investigator must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of the requirement and of the explanation or particulars, or the question and answer.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an FR investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars, or to answer a question, under section 25; and (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 39)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the explanation, particulars or answer might tend to incriminate the person, and the person claims this before giving the explanation or particulars, or answering the question, (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 39)

subsection.continued: the requirement, as well as the explanation or particulars, or the question and answer, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 31(1), (2), (5), (6) or (7), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), in relation to the explanation, particulars or answer.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a specified requirement. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with a specified requirement. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a specified requirement, the person produces a record or document, or gives an explanation, further particulars or an answer, that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the record, document, explanation, particulars or answer is false or misleading in a material particular. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in purported compliance with a specified requirement, the person, with intent to defraud, produces a record or document, or gives an explanation, further particulars or an answer, that is false or misleading in a material particular. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or allows another person to fail to comply with a specified requirement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: causes or allows another person, in purported compliance with a specified requirement, to produce a record or document, or give an explanation, further particulars or an answer, that is false or misleading in a material particular. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 40)

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a specified requirement only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under subsection (1), (2), (5), (6) or (7) in respect of a conduct if— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: those proceedings remain pending, or by reason of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person for the purposes of section 32(2)(b) in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (6) or (7) is liable— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedRequirement
def.leadIn: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 25(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 26(1) or (2). (Added 3 of 2019 s. 40)

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Report for investigation in relation to PIE auditors etc.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the completion of an investigation under this Division, the FR investigator must prepare and submit to the AFRC a written report in relation to the investigation. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The FR investigator— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may prepare an interim report in relation to the investigation, if the FR investigator considers it appropriate to do so; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must prepare an interim report in relation to the investigation, if required by the AFRC to do so.

subsection.leadIn: Before submitting an investigation report to the AFRC, the FR investigator must— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 55; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: send a dated draft of the report to—

subparagraph.content: the PIE auditor, non-PIE auditor or registered responsible person concerned; and
any other person named in the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give any person to whom the draft is sent under paragraph (a) a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 55)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: adopt the investigation report submitted by the FR investigator; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish or otherwise disclose the report or any part of it.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether to publish or otherwise disclose an investigation report or any part of it, the AFRC must take into account— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 55)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the publication or disclosure may adversely affect any of the following proceedings that have been, or are likely to be, instituted—

subparagraph.content: any proceedings under Part 3C;
any criminal proceedings before a court or magistrate;
any proceedings before the Market Misconduct Tribunal;
any proceedings before a Disciplinary Committee constituted under section 33(3) of the PA Ordinance as in force immediately before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 55)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the publication or disclosure may adversely affect any person named in the report; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the publication or disclosure would be in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a copy of an investigation report adopted under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be certified by the chairperson of the AFRC as a true copy of such a report,

subsection.continued: is, on its production without further proof, admissible as evidence of the facts stated in the report in any of the proceedings specified in subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: The proceedings are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings under Part 3C;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: civil proceedings before a court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: proceedings before the Market Misconduct Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: proceedings under section 41 of the PA Ordinance; or (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 55)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: proceedings before a Disciplinary Committee constituted under section 33(3) of the PA Ordinance as in force immediately before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date. (Added 41 of 2021 s. 55)

section.name: s31B
section.heading: Action by AFRC in relation to investigation under Division 3 of Part 3A

subsection.content: This section applies if an investigation report is submitted to the AFRC under section 31A.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may, in relation to the investigation— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 56)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: close the case without further action; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take any follow-up action in accordance with this Ordinance that the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the investigation was carried out under section 23, the AFRC may also impose a sanction on, or take an action in relation to, the PIE auditor or registered responsible person concerned under section 37D, 37E, 37F or 37I(1).
In exercising a power under subsection (2) or (3), the AFRC must have regard to the investigation report.

As soon as practicable after deciding to exercise a power under subsection (2), the AFRC must issue a written notice of the decision to the PIE auditor, non-PIE auditor or registered responsible person concerned, unless the AFRC is satisfied that the notification may prejudice an action by the AFRC, or a specified body, relating to the investigation.

section.name: s31C
section.heading: Costs and expenses of investigation in relation to PIE auditors etc.

subsection.content: If, on a prosecution instituted as a result of the findings of an investigation under this Division, a person is convicted by a court or magistrate, the court or magistrate may order the person to pay to the AFRC a sum that is the whole or a part of the costs and expenses of the investigation.
The AFRC may recover the sum so ordered as a civil debt due to it.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Supplementary Provisions Relating to Inspection and Investigation

section.name: s32
section.heading: Powers of Court of First Instance in relation to failure to comply with specified requirements

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a specified requirement, the FR inspector or FR investigator (as the case requires) may, by originating summons, request the Court of First Instance to exercise the powers under subsection (2). (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 43. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, order the person to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and, if applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 43)

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (1) is to be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no proceedings may be instituted against a person for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) in respect of a conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending, or by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under section 21F or 31 in respect of the same conduct. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedRequirement
def.leadIn: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 21C(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 21D(1) or (2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 25(1); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 26(1) or (2). (Added 3 of 2019 s. 43)

section.name: s33
section.heading: Inspection of records or documents seized, etc.
section.content: If an FR inspector or FR investigator has taken possession of any record or document under this Part, the FR inspector or FR investigator must, subject to any reasonable conditions the FR inspector or FR investigator imposes as to security or otherwise, permit any person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document had the FR inspector or FR investigator not taken possession of it under this Part, to inspect it and to make copies or otherwise record details of it at all reasonable times.

subsection.leadIn: If a magistrate is satisfied by information on oath laid by an FR inspector or FR investigator that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that there is, or is likely to be, on premises specified in the information any record or document that may be required to be produced under this Part, the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing a person specified in it, and such other person as may be necessary to assist in the execution of the warrant, to— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the premises, if necessary by force, at any time within 7 days, or any longer period specified in the warrant, beginning on the date of the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: search for, seize and remove any record or document that the person so specified has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under this Part. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45)

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person has reasonable cause to believe that another person on the premises is employed, or engaged to provide a service, in connection with a business that is or has been conducted on the premises, the authorized person may require that other person to produce for examination any record or document that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the possession of that other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under this Part. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person may, in relation to any record or document required to be produced under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit any person found on the premises from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: removing the record or document from the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: erasing anything from, adding anything to or otherwise altering anything in, the record or document; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: otherwise interfering in any manner with, or causing or permitting any other person to interfere with, the record or document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: take any other step that appears to the authorized person to be necessary for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: preserving the record or document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: preventing interference with the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Any record or document removed under this section may be retained for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period not exceeding 6 months beginning on the day of its removal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the record or document is or may be required for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any criminal proceedings;

subparagraph.name: ii

subparagraph.content: any proceedings under this Ordinance; (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 58)
any proceedings under section 41 of the PA Ordinance; or (Added 41 of 2021 s. 58)
any proceedings before a Disciplinary Committee constituted under section 33(3) of the PA Ordinance as in force immediately before the 2021 Ordinance commencement date, (Added 41 of 2021 s. 58)

paragraph.continued: such longer period as may be necessary for the purpose of those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person removes any record or document under this section, the person— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must as soon as practicable after the removal give a receipt for the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may permit any person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document but for the removal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to inspect it at all reasonable times; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of it at all reasonable times. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45)

subsection.content: Section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies to any property that has by virtue of this section come into the possession of the FR inspector or FR investigator, as it applies to property that has come into the possession of the police. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45; L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement or prohibition under subsection (2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obstructs an authorized person exercising a power conferred by subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (7) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.def: In this section, authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized by a warrant issued under subsection (1) to carry out the act set out in paragraphs (a) and (b) of that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a professional person is guilty of CPA misconduct if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does an act or makes an omission that amounts to a professional irregularity within the meaning of section 3B;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is convicted of an offence under section 21F or 31;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is punished by the Court of First Instance under section 32(2)(b) for failing to comply with a requirement imposed under section 21C(2), 21D(1) or (2), 25(1) or 26(1) or (2) or for being involved in the failure; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is punished by the Court of First Instance under section 45(2)(b) for failing to comply with a requirement imposed under section 43 or for being involved in the failure.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), where the professional person is a certified public accountant, the person is also guilty of CPA misconduct if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is convicted of an offence under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of any offence involving dishonesty.

subsection.leadIn: However, a professional person who does an act or makes an omission referred to in subsection (1)(a) is not to be regarded as being guilty of CPA misconduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a PIE auditor or a registered responsible person of a registered PIE auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act or omission amounts to a practice irregularity within the meaning of section 4; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has accordingly committed FR misconduct as described in section 37A or 37B. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

section.name: s37A
section.heading: FR misconduct by PIE auditors
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a PIE auditor has committed FR misconduct if the auditor— (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has contravened a condition imposed in relation to the registration or recognition of the auditor under Part 3;

paragraph.name: c
