paragraph.content: is a member of the AFRC, the Investigation Board, a Review Committee or a committee established by the AFRC; or (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 88)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: performs a function under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: If, in the course of performing a function under this Ordinance, a person is required to consider a matter in which the person has an interest that is of a class or description determined by the AFRC under subsection (3)(a), the person must immediately disclose the interest to the AFRC. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 88)

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the class or description of the interest required to be disclosed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the details of the interest required to be disclosed and the way in which the interest is to be disclosed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: from time to time change any matter determined under paragraph (a) or (b). (Replaced 21 of 2021 s. 88)

subsection.content: Particulars of a disclosure made under this section must be recorded by the AFRC in a book kept for the purpose and that book must be open at all reasonable hours for inspection by the public. (Replaced 21 of 2021 s. 88)

subsection.leadIn: After a person has disclosed an interest in a matter, the person must not, unless the AFRC otherwise determines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during a deliberation of the AFRC with respect to the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in a decision of the AFRC with respect to the matter. (Replaced 21 of 2021 s. 88)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of making a determination by the AFRC under subsection (5), a person who has an interest in a matter to which the disclosure relates must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during the AFRC’s deliberation for making the determination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in the AFRC’s making of the determination. (Replaced 21 of 2021 s. 88)

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC determines under subsection (5) that a person may be present during any deliberation, or take part in any decision, of the AFRC, Investigation Board or Review Committee, or a committee established by the AFRC, the AFRC must give written notice of the determination to— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 65; 41 of 2021 s. 88)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a deliberation or decision with respect to an inspection or investigation under Part 3AA or 3A, or an exercise of power under Part 3B—the practice unit, certified professional accountant, PIE auditor, non-PIE auditor or registered responsible person concerned, as the case requires; or (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 88)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a deliberation or decision with respect to an enquiry under Part 4 concerning a relevant non-compliance—the listed entity concerned.

subsection.content: A contravention of this section does not invalidate a decision of the AFRC, Investigation Board or Review Committee, or a committee established by the AFRC. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 88)
A person who complies with a specified requirement does not incur any civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, by reason only of the compliance.

A person does not incur any civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the person in good faith in the performance, or purported performance, of any function under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under—(aa)section 20ZZC(1); (Added 41 of 2021 s. 89)(aab)section 20ZZJ(1); (Added 41 of 2021 s. 89)(a)section 21C(2);(b)section 21D(1) or (2);(c)section 25(1);(d)section 26(1) or (2);(e)section 34; or(f)section 43. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 66)

section.name: s55
section.heading: Immunity in respect of communication with AFRC

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 54, if a person communicates in good faith to the AFRC any information or opinion on a specified matter— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 67; 41 of 2021 s. 90)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a practice unit of which the person becomes or became aware while working in or for the unit,

subsection.continued: the person does not incur any civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, by reason only of the communication. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 90)

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, subsection (1) applies even though the person has previously communicated the information or opinion to any other person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified matter (指明事宜)—(a)in relation to a listed entity—means a matter, whether occurring before, during or after the entity is or was listed, that, in the opinion of a person referred to in subsection (1)(a), suggests that—(i)a practice irregularity within the meaning of section 4 has been committed in relation to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement carried out for the entity;(ii)there is a relevant non-compliance within the meaning of section 5 in relation to the entity; or(iii)FR misconduct within the meaning of section 37A or 37B has been committed in relation to a PIE engagement or non-PIE engagement carried out for the entity; or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)(b)in relation to a practice unit—means a matter that, in the opinion of a person referred to in subsection (1)(b), suggests that a professional person is guilty of CPA misconduct within the meaning of section 37AA in relation to the unit. (Replaced 41 of 2021 s. 90)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Ordinance does not affect any claims, rights or entitlements that would, apart from this Ordinance, arise on the ground of legal professional privilege.

Subsection (1) does not affect any requirement under this Ordinance to disclose the name and address of a client of a legal practitioner (whether or not the legal practitioner is qualified in Hong Kong to practise as counsel or to act as a solicitor).

section.name: s57
section.heading: Production of information in information systems

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person may require the production of any record or document under Part 3AA, 3A or 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or matter contained in such record or document is recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form,

subsection.continued: the person may also require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter, or the relevant part of the recording, in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person may require the production of any record or document under Part 3AA, 3A or 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or matter contained in such record or document is recorded in an information system,

subsection.continued: the person may also require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter, or the relevant part of the recording, in a form that enables the information or matter to be reproduced in a legible form.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Lien claimed on records or documents
section.leadIn: If a person claims a lien on any record or document in the person’s possession that is required to be produced under Part 3AA, 3A or 4— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 69; 41 of 2021 s. 92)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lien does not affect the requirement to produce the record or document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no fee is payable for or in respect of the production; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the production does not affect the lien.

section.name: s58A
section.heading: Offences in relation to certificate or document presented to AFRC

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impersonates a person (person A) referred to in any certificate or document presented to the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: falsely represents himself, herself or itself as being person A.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

A person commits an offence if the person destroys, falsifies, conceals or otherwise disposes of, or causes or permits the destruction, falsification, concealment or disposal of, any record or document required to be produced under Part 3A or 4, with intent to conceal, from the person by whom the requirement to produce was imposed, facts or matters capable of being disclosed by the record or document. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 70)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: This section applies if a provision of this Ordinance that creates an offence makes a reference to a reasonable excuse for an act or omission.
The reference to a reasonable excuse is to be construed as providing for a defence to a charge in relation to the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: A defendant is to be taken to have established that the defendant had a reasonable excuse for the act or omission if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sufficient evidence is adduced to raise an issue that the defendant had such a reasonable excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.content: This section applies to a notice or other document required or permitted to be given, sent or issued (however described) under this Ordinance. (Replaced 3 of 2019 s. 72)

subsection.leadIn: Such a notice or document is taken to be given, sent or issued to a person if— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 72)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the individual’s last known business or residential address;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the individual’s last known facsimile number; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the individual’s last known electronic mail address; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 72)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to any officer of the company by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the company’s registered office in Hong Kong; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to its last known facsimile number; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to its last known electronic mail address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), it is— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered by hand to, or sent by post to, the person resident in Hong Kong who is authorized to accept service of process and notices on its behalf at the person’s address delivered to the Registrar of Companies under that Ordinance; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 72)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the last known facsimile number of the person; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partnership, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to any partner of the partnership by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the last known principal place of business of the partnership;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the last known facsimile number of the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the partnership;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a body corporate (other than a company, or a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)) or an unincorporated association (other than a partnership), it is— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to any officer of the body or association by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the last known principal place of business of the body or association;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the last known facsimile number of the body or association; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the body or association.

section.name: s60A
section.heading: Chief Executive in Council may make regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, after consulting the AFRC, make regulations— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prescribing fees and providing for payment of the fees—

subparagraph.content: for anything done by the AFRC or a committee established by the AFRC in performing a function under this Ordinance; and
for any other matter provided for by or under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing fees (however described) that are required or permitted to be prescribed by regulations made under this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing any other matter that, by this Ordinance, is required or permitted to be prescribed by regulations made under this section.

subsection.content: Fees prescribed by regulations made under this section are not to be limited by reference to the amount of the administrative or other costs incurred, or likely to be incurred, by the HKICPA or the AFRC (or a committee established by the HKICPA or the AFRC) in performing the functions to which the fees relate.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may provide that the amount of a fee is to be fixed by reference to a scale set out in the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may provide for the payment of different fees by persons, or in relation to persons or cases, of different classes or descriptions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may provide that the payment of a fee is waived, either generally or in a particular case; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may provide for the payment of fees annually or at other intervals.

subsection.content: The AFRC may recover the amount of any fee payable under the regulations made under this section as a civil debt due to it.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may make regulations— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 94)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: providing for the maintenance of the PIE auditors register and the correction of errors in the register;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: providing for the form and way in which documents and information required to be lodged, filed, submitted or retained for a provision of this Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: are to be completed, signed, executed or authenticated; or
are to be lodged, filed, submitted or retained;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: providing for the form and way in which a record is to be compiled for a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: providing for the returns to be made by PIE auditors and registered responsible persons of registered PIE auditors, including the contents of the returns, and the time within which and the form and way in which the returns are to be made; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prescribing any other matter that, by this Ordinance, is required or permitted to be prescribed by regulations made under this subsection.

subsection.content: In addition to the power to make regulations under subsection (1), the AFRC may, after consulting the Financial Secretary, make other regulations that are necessary for the performance of any of its functions. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 94)

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, regulations made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application or may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may authorize a matter or thing to be determined, applied or regulated by a specified person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may provide for the exercise of a discretion in specified cases; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: may, for the better carrying out of any provision of this Ordinance, include any savings, transitional, incidental, supplemental, evidential and consequential provisions (whether or not involving the provisions of an Ordinance).

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section may prescribe offences for contravention of the regulations, which are punishable by a fine, imprisonment or both.

subsection.leadIn: The maximum penalty that may be prescribed for an offence under subsection (4) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an offence of which a person is convicted on indictment—a fine of $500,000 and imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an offence of which a person is summarily convicted—a fine at level 6 and imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: If the AFRC proposes to make regulations under section 60B, it must publish a draft of the proposed regulations, in the way it considers appropriate, for inviting representations on the proposed regulations by the public.
If the AFRC makes regulations after a draft has been published under subsection (1), it must comply with subsections (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must publish, in the way it considers appropriate, an account setting out in general terms— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 95)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the representations made on the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the response of the AFRC to the representations.

subsection.content: If the AFRC considers the regulations made are significantly different from the draft, the AFRC must publish, in the way it considers appropriate, details of the difference.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if the AFRC considers, in the circumstances of the case, that— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 95)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is inappropriate or unnecessary that those subsections should apply; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the delay involved in complying with those subsections would not be—

subparagraph.content: in the interest of the investing public; or
in the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may specify— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 96)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form of any document required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of any other document required for the purposes of this Ordinance that the AFRC considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with the directions and instructions that are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the documents that are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the completed form is required to be provided to the AFRC or any other person, so provided in the way, if any, specified in the form.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 1A or 3B.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend Schedule 3A. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 74)
The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2, 4, 4A, 5, 6 or 7.

part.name: P8
part.heading: 2021 Amending Ordinance—Regulations for Transitional and Saving Provisions and Consequential Amendments

section.name: s94
section.heading: 2021 Amending Ordinance—regulations for transitional and saving provisions and consequential amendments

subsection.content: The Secretary may by regulation make transitional and saving provisions consequent on the enactment of the 2021 Amending Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the regulations may in particular provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application of this Ordinance, or the PA Ordinance, as amended by the 2021 Amending Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the continued application of a provision of the pre-amended Ordinance or of the pre-amended PAO for a period, or until the happening of an event, specified in the regulations; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) in addition to the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsections (1) and (2), the regulations may include matters relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: existing certified public accountants and existing practice units under the pre-amended PAO;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: existing PIE auditors under the pre-amended Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: existing practising certificates issued to certified public accountants under the pre-amended PAO;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: pending applications—

subparagraph.content: for the registration of practice units and the issue of practising certificates under the pre-amended PAO; and
for the registration of PIE auditors under the pre-amended Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: ongoing practice reviews carried out under the pre-amended PAO;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: complaints made under the pre-amended PAO;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: appeals on disciplinary sanction decisions; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the obtaining of information from the HKICPA for the purposes of paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) and (g).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), in relation to the provisions that continue to apply because of the regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: different periods may be specified for different provisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: different events may be specified for different provisions.

subsection.content: Further, the Secretary may by regulation make consequential or related amendments to any enactment as are necessary consequent on the enactment of the 2021 Amending Ordinance.
For the purposes of subsection (5), the regulations may include transitional and saving provisions relating to the consequential or related amendments.

The regulations may provide for any provision of the regulations to take effect on a date earlier than the date of publication of the regulations (publication date) but not earlier than the day on which section 98 of the 2021 Amending Ordinance comes into operation*.

subsection.leadIn: To the extent to which a provision of the regulations takes effect on a date earlier than the publication date, the provision does not operate so as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to affect, in a way prejudicial to any person (other than the Government or a public body), the rights of that person before the publication date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to impose liabilities on a person (other than the Government or a public body) in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, before the publication date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: regulations (《規例》) means regulations made under this section;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Definitions of Relevant Financial Report and Relevant Requirement

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance (except sections 5(2) and 50 of this Ordinance)—

def.name: RelevantFinancialReport
def.leadIn: relevant financial report (有關財務報告)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a listed corporation, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a balance sheet of the corporation, together with any accounts annexed to it for the purposes of section 129C(1) of the relevant Ordinance, a copy of which was sent under section 129G of that Ordinance to a person entitled to be sent the copy;

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.content: a copy of the financial statements of the corporation, which was sent under section 430 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to a member; (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the accounts of the corporation, a certified copy of which was delivered to the Registrar of Companies for registration under section 336 of the relevant Ordinance, or under section 789 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a summary financial report of the corporation, a copy of which was sent to a person entitled to be sent the copy in compliance with section 141CA of the relevant Ordinance, or to a member in accordance with section 441 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or in compliance with section 444 of that Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: a set of financial statements of the corporation—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: providing information on the state of affairs of the corporation as at the end of that period; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: issued, circulated, published or distributed for the purposes of the Listing Rules; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a specified report required for a listing document issued by or on behalf of the corporation; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a listed collective investment scheme, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: a set of financial statements of the scheme—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: providing information on the state of affairs of the scheme as at the end of that period; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: issued, circulated, published or distributed for the purposes of the relevant code or the Listing Rules; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a specified report required for a listing document issued by or on behalf of the scheme; (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 76)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a relevant financial report of a listed corporation, means an accounting requirement as to the matters or information to be included in the report, as provided in—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the standards of accounting practices issued or specified, or deemed to have been issued or specified, under section 18A of the PA Ordinance, as in force at the material time; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 99)

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: the Listing Rules; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any generally acceptable accounting principles allowed for usage under the Listing Rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a relevant financial report of a listed collective investment scheme, means an accounting requirement as to the matters or information to be included in the report, as provided in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the standards of accounting practices issued or specified, or deemed to have been issued or specified, under section 18A of the PA Ordinance, as in force at the material time; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 99)

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the Listing Rules;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any generally acceptable accounting principles allowed for usage under the Listing Rules; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the relevant code. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 76)

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: In sections 5(2) and 50 of this Ordinance—

def.name: RelevantFinancialReport
def.leadIn: relevant financial report (有關財務報告), in relation to a listed corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a balance sheet of the corporation, together with any accounts annexed to it for the purposes of section 129C(1) of the relevant Ordinance, a copy of which was sent under section 129G of that Ordinance to a person entitled to be sent the copy;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a copy of the financial statements of the corporation, which was sent under section 430 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to a member; (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary financial report of the corporation, a copy of which was sent to a person entitled to be sent the copy in compliance with section 141CA of the relevant Ordinance, or to a member in accordance with section 441 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or in compliance with section 444 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a specified report required for a prospectus issued by or on behalf of the corporation; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 3 of 2019 s. 76)

section.name: s0-1
section.def: relevant requirement (有關規定), in relation to a relevant financial report of a listed corporation, means an accounting requirement as to the matters or information to be included in the report, as provided in the relevant Ordinance or the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), as in force at the material time. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The preparation of an auditor’s report in relation to the following financial statements or accounts of a PIE—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the PIE is a listed corporation (equity)—

subparagraph.content: the financial statements required to be prepared under section 379 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or
the annual accounts required to be prepared under the Listing Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the PIE is a listed collective investment scheme—the annual accounts required to be prepared under the relevant code or the Listing Rules.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The preparation of a specified report required to be included in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a listing document of a corporation seeking to be listed for the listing of its shares or stocks;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a listing document of a listed corporation for the listing of its shares or stocks; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a listing document of—

subparagraph.content: a collective investment scheme seeking to be listed; or
a listed collective investment scheme.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The preparation of an accountant’s report required to be included in a circular issued by or on behalf of a PIE under the Listing Rules for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reverse takeover within the meaning of the Listing Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a very substantial acquisition within the meaning of the Listing Rules.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The preparation of an auditor’s report in relation to the following financial statements or accounts of a non-PIE—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements required to be prepared under section 379 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the annual accounts required to be prepared under the Listing Rules.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The preparation of a specified report required to be included in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a listing document of a corporation seeking to be listed for the listing of its securities (other than shares and stocks); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a listing document of a listed corporation for the listing of its securities (other than shares and stocks).

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: AFRC member (會財局成員) means a member of the AFRC appointed under section 7; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 100)
Chairperson (主席) means the chairperson of the AFRC; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)
Deputy Chairperson (副主席) means the deputy chairperson of the AFRC. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

subsection.content: In this Schedule, a reference to a person being unable to perform the person’s functions is a reference to the person being unable to do so due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Appointment of Deputy Chairperson
section.content: The Chief Executive may appoint an AFRC member (other than the Chairperson or the Chief Executive Officer) to be the Deputy Chairperson.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Functions of AFRC members
section.content: An AFRC member has the functions assigned to the member by the AFRC.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Terms and conditions of office of AFRC members

subsection.content: The Chief Executive is to determine the terms and conditions of the office of an AFRC member.
The remuneration, allowances and expenses of an AFRC member, as determined by the Chief Executive, are to be paid out of the funds of the AFRC.
An AFRC member may at any time resign from office by written notice to the Chief Executive. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

subsection.leadIn: Unless it is otherwise provided in the terms and conditions referred to in section 4(1) of this Schedule, a notice of resignation takes effect on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day on which the notice is received by the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later day is specified in the notice—that later day.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may remove an AFRC member from office if the Chief Executive is satisfied that the member— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has ceased to be a non-practitioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become a public officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is convicted in Hong Kong of an offence that is punishable by imprisonment for 12 months or more, or is convicted elsewhere than in Hong Kong of an offence that, if committed in Hong Kong, would be an offence so punishable; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of an AFRC member. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must publish in the Gazette a notice of each removal under subsection (1).
If the office of Chairperson is vacant or the Chairperson is unable to perform the Chairperson’s functions, the Deputy Chairperson must act as Chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: Whether or not the Deputy Chairperson has been appointed, the Chairperson may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate an AFRC member to act as Chairperson for any period during which both the Chairperson and the Deputy Chairperson are unable to act as Chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the office of Deputy Chairperson is vacant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Deputy Chairperson appointed is unable to act as Chairperson;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no designation under subsection (2)(a) is in force; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the AFRC member designated under subsection (2)(a) is unable to act as Chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate an AFRC member to act as Chairperson for any period during which the Chairperson is unable to perform the Chairperson’s functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: A designation under subsection (4)(a) ceases to have effect when the earliest of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation is revoked by the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
f
paragraph.content: if the designation is made in the circumstances mentioned in subsection (3)(d)—the designated AFRC member is able to act as Chairperson.

subsection.content: An AFRC member acting as Chairperson under this section is to be regarded for all purposes to be the Chairperson.

Despite subsection (6), an executive director or non-executive director of the AFRC who acts as Chairperson under this section does not cease to be regarded as such a director only because the director is acting as Chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate an executive director of the AFRC to act as Chief Executive Officer for any period during which the Chief Executive Officer is unable to perform the Officer’s functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no designation under subsection (1)(a) is in force; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the executive director designated under subsection (1)(a) is unable to act as Chief Executive Officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate an executive director of the AFRC to act as Chief Executive Officer for any period during which the Chief Executive Officer is unable to perform the Officer’s functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: A designation under subsection (3)(a) ceases to have effect when the earliest of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation is revoked by the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the designated executive director is unable to act as Chief Executive Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive Officer is able to perform the Officer’s functions.

subsection.content: An executive director of the AFRC acting as Chief Executive Officer under this section is to be regarded for all purposes to be the Chief Executive Officer.
Meetings of the AFRC are to be held as often as necessary to enable the AFRC to perform its functions.
A meeting of the AFRC may be convened by the Chairperson.
The Chairperson must convene a meeting of the AFRC on being given a notice for that purpose by 2 or more other AFRC members.
The procedures for convening meetings of the AFRC and for the conduct of business at those meetings are, subject to this Ordinance, to be determined by the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: The quorum for a meeting of the AFRC is constituted by— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: one-third of the non-executive directors of the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the number that is equal to one-third of the executive directors or non-executive directors of the AFRC is not a whole number, that number is to be rounded up to the nearest whole number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an executive director of the AFRC who acts as Chairperson is only counted as an executive director of the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a non-executive director of the AFRC who acts as Chairperson is only counted as a non-executive director of the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: If an AFRC member is required under section 53(5) or (6)— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not to be present during any deliberation of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: not to take part in the making of a determination by the AFRC,

subsection.continued: the member is not to be counted for the purpose of forming a quorum at the part of the meeting of the AFRC held for such deliberation, decision or determination.

subsection.leadIn: An AFRC member who participates in a meeting of the AFRC by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means is to be regarded as being present at the meeting if— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that member is able to hear the other AFRC members who are physically present at the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the AFRC members who are physically present at the meeting are able to hear that member.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Presiding member at meetings
section.leadIn: A meeting of the AFRC is to be presided over by the first of the following persons (in descending order of priority) who is able to preside at the meeting— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairperson;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Deputy Chairperson;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the AFRC member designated under section 7(2)(a) of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the AFRC member designated under section 7(4)(a) of this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an AFRC member who is chosen, for this purpose, by other AFRC members present at the meeting.

subsection.content: Each AFRC member present at a meeting of the AFRC has 1 vote.
Every question to be decided at a meeting of the AFRC must be determined by a majority of the votes of its members present.
If the votes on a question are equally divided, the AFRC member who presides at the meeting has, subject to subsection (4), a casting vote.
The AFRC member who presides at a meeting of the AFRC must not exercise a casting vote on a question at the meeting until after the member has consulted the Financial Secretary on the question.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Circulation of papers and written resolution

subsection.content: The AFRC may transact any of its business by circulation of papers.
A resolution that meets the requirements set out in subsection (3) is as valid as if it had been passed at a meeting of the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the resolution is in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution is signed by all the AFRC members who are, when the resolution is made available for signature, present in Hong Kong and capable of signing the resolution; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the resolution is signed by—

subparagraph.content: at least one-third of the non-executive directors of the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a resolution may be—

subparagraph.content: in the form of one document; or
in the form of more than one document, each of which is in the same form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the number that is equal to one-third of the executive directors or non-executive directors of the AFRC is not a whole number, that number is to be rounded up to the nearest whole number.

subsection.content: If a resolution is in the form of more than one document, the requirements under subsection (3)(b) and (c) are to be regarded as having been met if the documents together bear the signatures of the numbers of AFRC members as specified in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a resolution is regarded as having been signed by an AFRC member if a fax or electronic transmission of the resolution bears the signature of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution is regarded as made on the day on which the resolution is signed by the last person signing as an AFRC member.

subsection.leadIn: The Advisory Committee is to consist of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not more than 2 executive directors of the AFRC (other than the chief executive officer), as appointed by the AFRC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least 8 but not more than 12 other persons, as appointed by the Financial Secretary after consulting the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if a person ceases to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person appointed by the AFRC under subsection (1)(c)—an executive director of the AFRC,

subsection.continued: the person ceases to be a member of the Advisory Committee.

subsection.content: A member of the Advisory Committee may at any time resign from office by written notice to the Financial Secretary or (for a member appointed under section 13A(1)(c) of this Schedule) to the AFRC.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day on which the notice is received by the Financial Secretary or the AFRC (as appropriate); or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a later day is specified in the notice—that later day.

section.name: s13C
section.heading: Removal of members
section.content: The Financial Secretary may remove from office a member of the Advisory Committee appointed under section 13A(1)(c) or (d) of this Schedule by written notice to the member.

subsection.leadIn: A meeting of the Advisory Committee may be convened by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the AFRC; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other 3 members of the Advisory Committee.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Advisory Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairperson of the AFRC is present, the chairperson is to preside over the meeting; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairperson of the AFRC is not present, the members of the Advisory Committee present are to choose one among themselves to preside over the meeting.

subsection.content: The AFRC may establish one or more committees to assist it in a matter with which it is concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must appoint an AFRC member to be the chairperson of a committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, subject to subsection (3), appoint other members of a committee, whether or not any of them is also an AFRC member.

subsection.content: Among the members of a committee, the number of AFRC members must exceed the number of non-AFRC members.
The AFRC may refer a matter with which it is concerned to a committee for consideration, inquiry or management.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC may— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke an appointment under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw a reference under subsection (4).

subsection.content: The procedures for convening meetings of a committee and for the conduct of business at those meetings are, subject to any direction of the AFRC, to be determined by the committee.

subsection.leadIn: The AFRC must have a seal the affixing of which must be authenticated by— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 100)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the signature of the Chairperson or the Deputy Chairperson; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the signature of another AFRC member authorized to sign on behalf of the AFRC.

subsection.content: A document purporting to be a document duly executed under the seal of the AFRC is to be received in evidence without further proof and is, unless the contrary is proved, to be regarded as a document so executed on being received in evidence.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Organization of administration etc.
section.content: The AFRC must organize and regulate its administration, procedure and business in a way that it considers will, subject to the requirements of this Ordinance, best ensure the performance of its functions.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The following functions of the AFRC are specified for the purposes of section 11(2)— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make subsidiary legislation under this Ordinance or any other Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to borrow money under section 10(2)(e);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to publish or otherwise make available, under section 10(2)(h), materials indicating to the public any matter relating or incidental to the performance by the AFRC of any of its functions; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to issue guidelines under section 13;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to submit, under section 17(3), estimates of income and expenditure of the AFRC for approval by the Financial Secretary; (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to cause to be prepared a statement of accounts of the AFRC under section 18(2); (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to submit to the Financial Secretary under section 20(1) the documents referred to in that section;

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: to appoint a person to be a CPA inspector under section 20ZZA(1)(b); (Added 41 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: gb
paragraph.content: to appoint a person to be a CPA investigator under section 20ZZG(1)(b); (Added 41 of 2021 s. 101)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to appoint a person to be an FR inspector under section 21A(1)(b); (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
to appoint a person to be an FR investigator under section 22A(1)(b); (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: to specify, under section 37ZD(2), the day on which a specified decision is to take effect;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: to consult, under section 50D(1), the Financial Secretary with a view to recommending to the Chief Executive in Council that the rate or amount of a levy be reduced, and to recommend, under section 50D(3), to the Chief Executive in Council that the rate or amount of a levy be reduced;

paragraph.name: ka
paragraph.content: to appoint a person to be a member of the Advisory Committee under section 13A(1)(c) of Schedule 2; (Added 41 of 2021 s. 101)
to establish a committee under section 14(1) of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: to appoint a person to be the chairperson or a member of a committee under section 14(2) of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: to refer a matter to a committee under section 14(4) of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to revoke the appointment of the chairperson or a member of a committee, or to withdraw a reference from a committee, under section 14(5) of Schedule 2.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Provisions Relating to Investigation Board and its Members

subsection.content: A member appointed to the Investigation Board under section 22(2)(b) of this Ordinance is to be appointed for a term fixed by the AFRC at the time of the member’s appointment.
On the expiry of the period of appointment or reappointment of a member of the Investigation Board, the member is eligible for reappointment.
All matters relating to the terms and conditions of the appointment of a member of the Investigation Board are to be determined by the AFRC.

A member of the Investigation Board may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the AFRC. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the AFRC of the notice.

If, because of absence from Hong Kong or any other reason, a member of the Investigation Board, other than the chairperson, is unable to perform the member’s functions, the AFRC may appoint another person to be a temporary member in the member’s place during the member’s absence or incapacity. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 81; 41 of 2021 s. 105)
If a person is appointed as a temporary member of the Investigation Board, the person may perform all the functions of the member in whose place the person is appointed.

subsection.leadIn: If the AFRC is satisfied that a member of the Investigation Board appointed under section 22(2)(b) of this Ordinance— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 81; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is convicted in Hong Kong of an offence that is punishable by imprisonment for 12 months or more or is convicted elsewhere than in Hong Kong of an offence that, if committed in Hong Kong, would be an offence so punishable; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member of the Investigation Board,

subsection.continued: the AFRC may declare the member’s office to be vacant, and upon such declaration the office becomes vacant.

subsection.content: The AFRC must give notice of a declaration under subsection (1) in such manner as it thinks fit.
Subsection (4) applies if notice of a declaration is given under subsection (2) otherwise than by notice published in the Gazette.
The AFRC must, as soon as practicable after having given notice under subsection (2), give another notice of the declaration by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meetings and proceedings, etc. of Investigation Board

subsection.content: The chairperson of the Investigation Board must convene the meetings of the Board as the chairperson considers necessary for the Board to perform its functions. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 81)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A meeting of the Investigation Board is to be presided over by the first of the following persons (in descending order of priority) who is able to preside at the meeting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the AFRC;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an executive director of the AFRC designated under section 8(3)(a) of Schedule 2; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Board who is chosen, for this purpose, by other members of the Board present at the meeting. (Added 3 of 2019 s. 81. Amended 41 of 2021 s. 105)

subsection.content: The quorum for a meeting of the Investigation Board is 2 members of the Board or one half of the members of the Board, whichever is the greater.

If a member of the Investigation Board is required under section 53(5) of this Ordinance not to be present during any deliberation of, or not to take part in any decision of, the Board, the member is not to be counted for the purpose of forming a quorum at such part of a meeting of the Board that is held for such deliberation or decision. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 81)
The Investigation Board may transact any of its business by circulation of papers.

subsection.leadIn: The Investigation Board may, subject to this Ordinance and any direction of the AFRC, determine— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 81; 41 of 2021 s. 105)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedure for convening meetings of the Board and for the conduct of business at those meetings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procedure in the transaction of business of the Board by circulation of papers.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: chairperson (主席) means the chairperson of the Tribunal;
ordinary member (普通成員) means a member of the Tribunal other than the chairperson;
panel member (委員) means a member of the Tribunal panel appointed under section 3 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: The chairperson must be appointed by the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be—

subparagraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal;
a former judge, a former recorder or a former deputy judge of the Court of First Instance; or
a person who is eligible for appointment as a judge of the High Court under section 9 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be a public officer.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may be appointed—

subparagraph.content: for a term not exceeding 3 years; or
for a specified review; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be reappointed from time to time.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must appoint persons to a Tribunal panel comprising the number of members the Chief Executive considers appropriate.
A panel member must not be a public officer.
A panel member is appointed for a period the Chief Executive considers appropriate, and may be reappointed from time to time.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Resignation and removal of chairperson and panel members

subsection.content: The chairperson or a panel member may at any time resign from office by written notice to the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day on which the notice is received by the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later day is specified in the notice—that later day.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may by written notice remove the chairperson or a panel member from office on the ground of incapacity, bankruptcy, neglect of duty, conflict of interest or misconduct.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Appointment and resignation of ordinary members

subsection.content: For determining a review, the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury must, on the recommendation of the chairperson, appoint 2 panel members as ordinary members for the review.
An ordinary member appointed for a specified review may, subject to other provisions of this Ordinance, be appointed for any other review.
An ordinary member may at any time resign from office by written notice to the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day on which the notice is received by the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later day is specified in the notice—that later day.

subsection.content: If an ordinary member ceases to be a panel member, he or she ceases to be an ordinary member.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Chairperson and ordinary members entitled to be paid for services

subsection.content: The chairperson or an ordinary member is entitled to be paid, as a fee for services, an amount the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury considers appropriate.
An amount payable under subsection (1) is a charge on the general revenue.
Subsection (2) applies if the chairperson is prevented by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason from performing the functions of the chairperson.

The Chief Executive may appoint a person who is qualified for appointment as the chairperson under section 2(2) of this Schedule to act as chairperson, and perform all the functions of the chairperson (including acting as sole member of the Tribunal under section 12 of this Schedule), for any period during which the chairperson is prevented from performing those functions.
Subsection (4) applies if an ordinary member is prevented by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason from taking part in a particular review.

The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may appoint another panel member to act as ordinary member, and take part in the particular review, for any period during which the ordinary member is prevented from so taking part.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Further provisions relating to chairperson and ordinary members

subsection.content: If, on the expiry of the term of appointment of the chairperson or an acting chairperson, a review has commenced but not yet been completed, the Chief Executive may authorize the person to continue to act as chairperson or acting chairperson for the purpose of completing the review.

subsection.leadIn: If, during review proceedings, there is a change in the membership of the Tribunal, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if all the parties to the review so consent, the proceedings may continue despite that change; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of such a consent, the proceedings must not continue but must begin over again.

subsection.content: The chairperson must convene the sittings of the Tribunal that are necessary to determine a review.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson may, at any time after a review application has been made, give directions to the parties to the review concerning—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedural matters to be complied with by the parties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time within which the parties are required to comply with those matters.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 12 of this Schedule, at any sitting of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson and 2 ordinary members must be present;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chairperson must preside;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the order of proceedings must be determined by the Tribunal in the way most appropriate to the circumstances of the case;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: every question before the Tribunal (other than a question of law) must be determined by a majority of votes cast by the chairperson and the ordinary members; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a question of law before the Tribunal must be determined by the chairperson alone.

subsection.leadIn: The parties to a review are, at any sitting of the Tribunal relating to the review, entitled to be heard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in person, or—

subparagraph.content: for a partnership—through a partner; or
for a sole proprietorship—through the owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through counsel or solicitor or, with the leave of the Tribunal, through any other person.

subsection.content: The chairperson must prepare, or cause to be prepared, a record of the proceedings at any sitting of the Tribunal, which must contain the particulars relating to the proceedings the chairperson considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: At any time after a review application has been made, the chairperson may direct that a conference, to be attended by the parties to the review or their representatives and presided over by the chairperson, is to be held for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enabling the parties to prepare for the conduct of the review;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assisting the Tribunal to determine issues for the purpose of the review; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: generally securing the just, expeditious and economical conduct of the review.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson may give a direction under subsection (1) on his or her own initiative or on application by any of the parties to the review if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the parties agree to the giving of the direction.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must endeavour to secure that the parties to the review make all agreements that they reasonably ought to make in relation to the review.

subsection.content: After a conference has been held as directed under subsection (1), the chairperson must report to the Tribunal on the matters relating to the conference the chairperson considers appropriate.

If, at any time after a review application has been made, the parties to the review consent to all the terms of an order that the Tribunal or chairperson may make under any provision of this Ordinance, the Tribunal or chairperson may make the order even though a requirement applicable to the making of the order has not been complied with.
An order made under subsection (1) is to be regarded for all purposes as an order made under the provision concerned in compliance with the requirements applicable to the making of the order.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: order (命令) includes any finding, determination and any other decision.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Chairperson as sole member of Tribunal

subsection.content: The chairperson may determine a review as the sole member of the Tribunal if the condition specified in subsection (2) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that, at any time after a review application has been made but before any sitting of the Tribunal is held to determine the review, the parties to the review—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have agreed that the review may be determined by the chairperson as the sole member of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have informed the Tribunal of the agreement by written notice.

subsection.content: The chairperson may also determine as the sole member of the Tribunal an application under section 37R for an extension of the time within which a review application may be made.

If subsection (1) or (3) applies, the Tribunal constituted by the chairperson as the sole member of the Tribunal is to be regarded for all purposes as the Tribunal constituted by the chairperson and 2 ordinary members.

After making a determination under subsection (1) or (3), the chairperson must report to the Tribunal on the determination and the reasons for the determination, and any other matter relating to the determination the chairperson considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (7) applies if there is an application under section 37R and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson cannot determine the application due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chairperson considers it improper or undesirable that he or she should determine the application.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may appoint a person who is qualified for appointment as the chairperson under section 2(2) of this Schedule to determine the application in question as if the person were the chairperson duly appointed under this Ordinance, and the provisions of this Ordinance are to apply to the person accordingly.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Privileges and immunities
section.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, the following persons have the same privileges and immunities in relation to a review as they would have if the review were civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal, chairperson and ordinary members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties to, and any witness, counsel, solicitor or any other person involved in, the review.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Provisions Relating to Review Panel and its Members

subsection.content: A member of the Review Panel is to be appointed for a term not exceeding 3 years.
On the expiry of the period of appointment or reappointment of a member of the Review Panel, the member is eligible for reappointment. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 83)

A member of the Review Panel may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the Chief Executive. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a member of the Review Panel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is convicted in Hong Kong of an offence that is punishable by imprisonment for 12 months or more or is convicted elsewhere than in Hong Kong of an offence that, if committed in Hong Kong, would be an offence so punishable; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member of the Review Panel,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may declare the member’s office to be vacant, and upon such declaration the office becomes vacant.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must give notice of a declaration under subsection (1) in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit.
Subsection (4) applies if notice of a declaration is given under subsection (2) otherwise than by notice published in the Gazette.
The Chief Executive must, as soon as practicable after having given notice under subsection (2), give another notice of the declaration by notice published in the Gazette.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Provisions Relating to Review Committee and its Members

section.name: s1
section.heading: Meetings and proceedings, etc. of Review Committee

subsection.content: The chairperson of a Review Committee must convene the meetings of the Committee as the chairperson considers necessary for the Committee to perform its functions. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 84)
The quorum for a meeting of a Review Committee is one half of the members of the Committee.

If a member of a Review Committee is required under section 53(5) of this Ordinance not to be present during any deliberation of, or not to take part in any decision of, the Committee, the member is not to be counted for the purpose of forming a quorum at such part of a meeting of the Committee that is held for such deliberation or decision. (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 84)
A Review Committee may transact any of its business by circulation of papers.

subsection.leadIn: A Review Committee may, subject to this Ordinance and any direction of the AFRC, determine— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 84; 41 of 2021 s. 103)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedure for convening meetings of the Committee and for the conduct of business at those meetings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procedure in the transaction of business of the Committee by circulation of papers.

subsection.content: A member of a Review Committee may resign from office by giving notice in writing to the AFRC. A notice of resignation takes effect on the date specified in the notice or, if no date is specified, on the date of receipt by the AFRC of the notice. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 103)
If a member of a Review Committee ceases to be a member of the Review Panel, he or she ceases to be the member of the Committee.

subsection.leadIn: If a vacancy occurs among the members of a Review Committee by reason of death, resignation or otherwise, the AFRC may appoint— (Amended 3 of 2019 s. 84; 41 of 2021 s. 103)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), another member of the Review Panel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a vacancy in the office of the chairperson of the Committee, another Panel Convenor appointed under section 39(2) of this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: to fill the vacancy.

subsection.content: If the AFRC appoints a member of the Review Panel, or a Panel Convenor, under subsection (1) to fill a vacancy, the AFRC must notify the listed entity concerned in writing of the name of the member or Panel Convenor. (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 103)

If, because of absence from Hong Kong or any other reason, the chairperson of a Review Committee is unable to perform the chairperson’s functions, the AFRC may appoint, from amongst the Panel Convenors appointed under section 39(2) of this Ordinance, a temporary chairperson to act in the chairperson’s place during the chairperson’s absence or incapacity.

If, because of absence from Hong Kong or any other reason, a member of a Review Committee, other than the chairperson, is unable to perform the member’s functions, the AFRC may appoint another member of the Review Panel to be a temporary member in the member’s place during the member’s absence or incapacity.

If a person is appointed as the temporary chairperson, or a temporary member, of a Review Committee, the person may perform all the functions of the chairperson, or member, in whose place the person is appointed.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Levies payable by sellers and purchasers of securities

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the levy payable for a sale and purchase of securities is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the seller—0.00015% of the consideration for the sale; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purchaser—0.00015% of the consideration for the purchase.

subsection.content: No levy is payable for a sale and purchase of a stock option.

subsection.leadIn: No levy is payable for a sale and purchase of securities by an exchange participant, if the exchange participant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a securities market maker permit in relation to the securities that is in force at the time of the sale or purchase; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes the sale or purchase in the course of making a market for the securities.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: exchange participant (交易所參與者) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
securities market maker permit (證券莊家執照) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Securities and Futures (Levy) Order (Cap. 571 sub. leg. Z).

subsection.content: The levy payable by a PIE for a calendar year is 4.2% of the prepaid annual listing fee.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the prepaid annual listing fee is the annual listing fee that is payable by the PIE to the HKEC in advance in 1 instalment for the calendar year under the Listing Rules.

The levy payable by a PIE for a calendar year, as calculated in accordance with subsection (1), is not to be adjusted even if the annual listing fee payable by the PIE to the HKEC for the year is subsequently adjusted under the Listing Rules.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the levy payable by a PIE auditor for a calendar year is the sum of—
subsection.continued:
where—
N
=
the number of PIEs for which the auditor is carrying out, as at 31 December of the preceding calendar year, an engagement specified in item 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1A (specified engagement); and
TR
=
the total remuneration paid to the auditor, in the preceding calendar year, by the PIEs for which the auditor carried out specified engagements.

subsection.content: However, if N is 0, the levy payable by the PIE auditor for the calendar year is $2,000.

subsection.leadIn: For ascertaining N and TR, the AFRC may refer to— (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 104)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the annual financial statements of the PIEs submitted to the HKEC under the Listing Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or document provided by the PIE auditor to the AFRC under section 50C(2). (Amended 41 of 2021 s. 104)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a PIE auditor is carrying out an engagement for a PIE on a day if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the auditor undertakes the engagement on that day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the auditor has undertaken the engagement before that day and the engagement has not been completed by that day.
